subject: New PJM Schedule Notification Time
body:
Attention Amigos, please read the following.

12/26/2000 Note -- PJM Pilot Program

PJM is implementing a pilot program effective 0900 Thursday, December 28, 
2000. 

PJM is reducing the time required to request a change to an existing 
interchange transaction and purchase hourly transmission from 30 to 20 
minutes. 
Changes to interchange transactions will continue to be guaranteed with 30 
minutes notice. 
Changes will be accommodated with 20 minutes notice on a best effort basis. 
To accommodate the reduced notification time for interchange transactions, 
transactions without a linked NERC Tag will not be approved until a Tag is 
linked. Transactions that remain untagged 20 minutes prior to the transaction 
start time will be rejected. As always, transactions without a NERC Tag will 
hold ramp.

subject: Re: Session with Clara
body:
Good morning Cecilia Iâ€™m excited to come in with Clara today. She was a little confused as she didnâ€™t know if she also had a session tomorrow and was hoping to only have one this week. Can you confirm that she has a session tomorrow and if so, is it OK to cancel?

________________________________
From: Cecilia Blauvelt <user_4bcf3965@example.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 6, 2025 10:54:21 AM
To: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com>
Subject: Re: Session with Clara

Yes everything is totally fine! She just wants to discuss something with you and thinks its best if I'm there as support. :-) See you guys in my office on Monday, August 18th at 12:00 pm!

On Wed, Aug 6, 2025 at 10:20â€¯AM Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>> wrote:
Sounds great. Is everything ok?

________________________________
From: Cecilia Blauvelt <user_4bcf3965@example.com<mailto:user_4bcf3965@example.com>>
Sent: Wednesday, August 6, 2025 10:15:13 AM
To: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>>
Subject: Re: Session with Clara

Great! I can do Monday, August 18th at noon?

On Tue, Aug 5, 2025 at 12:00â€¯PM Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>> wrote:
Absolutely. I am available Mon and Fri.

________________________________
From: Cecilia Blauvelt <user_4bcf3965@example.com<mailto:user_4bcf3965@example.com>>
Sent: Tuesday, August 5, 2025 10:45:14 AM
To: user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com> <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>>
Subject: Session with Clara

Hello Matt!

I hope you are having a great summer. I heard you have a new congrats! I am reaching out because Clara would like to have a session with you to discuss a specific topic. I typically see her twice a month (I just saw her today). She would prefer an in person session the week of August 18th. Do you have any availability?

Thank You!
Cecilia

--
Cecilia Blauvelt, LMFT
Family Dynamics NJ
(201) 701- 0939


--
Cecilia Blauvelt, LMFT

(201) 701- 0939

subject: Help your children get ready to use Gemini Apps
body:
Manage your childrenâ€™s access to Gemini with Googleâ€™s Family Link

Hi Matt,

Gemini  
Apps<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5r6KTbLturPSxG3qZUv1Fy1E1O-oZky7UfOI7C6TQntitFGCKhsQH1_tMViqXaFFlt1TcNx4ZK43YP3BpNVYt9Bq6HVBbnXYoR4swMNcj0rbFYUbDgqZT6MlsETqI_cYAYKS2GvKa2f4g4wjvA>  
will soon be available for your children.

That means that your children will be able to use Gemini to find  
inspiration, learn new things, and do things like:

- Create stories, songs, and poetry

- Ask questions

- Get homework help and more

Youâ€™re in control with Family Link

Family Link is a parental controls app that helps you guide your childrenâ€™s  
online experience. Family Link allows you to manage their important account  
and data settings.

Your children will be able to access Gemini Apps soon. Weâ€™ll also let you  
know when your children access Gemini for the first time.

You can manage these settings, including turning access off, from the  
Family Link app or  
familylink.google.com<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5oZNW32wVSFkVbui1VifSddeIYd7cbIvTLm-ayYyKjurAxyhhiPVJGEloc9xlxhkuKod3auRmZERo73fj9QwyouvPmjru8TwTl4pi3QU1zfOdY8PQT2Eu6xhukZZbDItRJoNWI7>.  
Learn  
more<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5qTivOW4nQi4wwWbpPdmYChJLAHgMJVT08gF6wxzBJkFHrz5rP6SIKeLahkr4jyRVtA1HkUXtjP7b5jN5N7Zr5OQewdzXooVgkZNiePyFRQRNJnwgkWYgSIlPFWF76qCVAbnNONS_-HToeGE9BmlHLa6dIq1SDsRqTuqQvQ>.

Help your children get ready to use Gemini

Together, you and your children can get to know Gemini and learn how to use  
AI tools responsibly by checking out these resources:

- Get to know what Gemini Apps can do. Read  
FAQ<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5oEGQG-33cUfiyr6_DKZCn9P_3pMqCxFepNMTq1agkuusEr-9td_kz_j5z_h3dckCXIjlolkZFp4ALGd5BQpemKFmev33Dc1ug4EE9dFr_-yix1Q9ALNpe3bABfUxpJdhYN5Dm8gxNL>

- Use this conversation  
guide<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5rw_ByjbH_ghGpczJUEqLHlhrBN7BUi27H__E9qXIpLHwjdpRJfgEn_bA70fupCenQR6fPE4xfFdaq17mbY6hROVxpgIbwovyGjhm2cxCvLZprF5aBm8hHNnu5FNFLKPYuaLrxD4Oq_k6DnrvDThw>  
to talk about AI with your family

- Learn the five must-knows to get started with AI. Watch  
video<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5q7DFSSjFYwp3aaHcOaMgIZ7Sj9KpFlBN1TlCUYMcYk_XnQ2lsCEI_1m9k7qpPY_j_Hgknt-bBi5cjyODx-dgXaHndB_KJUHr1ijLb8tM5hjUxfobfJs-aEiyQkDgRxaZkDbswcgZwD-hbMAgEnmY9X5es>

Some helpful reminders

Gemini can make mistakes, so help your children think critically about  
Gemini responses.

- Remind your children that Gemini isnâ€™t human. Even though it sometimes  
talks like one, it canâ€™t think for itself or feel emotions
- Show your children how to  
double-check<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5r-Zgwskd3vAlGgtUeuhNJ2GJB8P3ecz2iS3BcvSliRgbBmwWaR08a9HY4o_HQO-3p7LOmzuLSh8SbnetpCR7iNyjXRCsDe_UM2PKbynqyeYJJAdGppblk7GolG8L9pJI0UANZlzmPFVWADVLaVLHx5pQpK0aKJ5pI8gjnFIJrJ>  
responses

- Let your children know not to enter sensitive or personal info in Gemini

- Our filters try to limit access to inappropriate content, but theyâ€™re not  
perfect. Your children may encounter content you donâ€™t want them to see

- Google Assistant Parental Controls will remain in Family Link and will  
continue to apply to Google Assistant devices in the home but will not  
apply to Gemini

How your children can access Gemini

When your children are signed in to a device or Gemini with their Google  
Account, hereâ€™s what theyâ€™ll be able to do:

- Use Gemini Apps on  
Android<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5p5ENa-VXDLM25I6CWB6NdUmrTb95qqbJii1SXkGPRtVX_NgrJZjo596kJHIE4T68s7k-VzpR0wHCFV7MBStriEe0mtwq4MTwrGhg250c9M1yLdJaU7J0XhRPDopM0pw5PLDR3JxheBz5hTD8Jhym5pt-1X0peeir8BjA>,  
iOS<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5qFs_6_EeB-30okPyygLk6nOsGrwUr_iYsMIYr07a8IW9BwP0UMVbbIqxvyL1lqI8KWmij_FxGIK5kXPl23cBHRCx74YtLkNB7rSIXTqdG5ED7C3Rf_JICx2IBgpM3d0rzsDHlaq776x3v704rQhxvL53YoRTUZ>,  
and the  
web<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5oBkUM_fTVZIG2pn5HKM7EzXLL3esCiBrdOUQx7HZCKJJxy3aRlCrYCt5FfvJ-w4L2w9SsYF7YzYdFg4DrjYVmHdX-bABiDLr80dZDKiD7FYIuOjZo6KoC4TTKQeQAyTdTSr3dKHRCK5ewyYrrqCDk0YPODK-LJ>

- Set Gemini as their mobile assistant on their Android device

- Use Gemini on Android phones and tablets, even from the lock screen.  
Learn  
more<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5pv65_FQhCoiwGDLjCOMZw9IJ4AwK_LCSmUgB2G2nqUNZYTnp87127rJtV-yFbLVX8TtnpbHrcxLxPI1mZaii_uoUVtPM6vozYQW7fxt04dWcZuVClUsBiBd8TaiZfaw39NiZ3aLMh78O2hlZZ8frNAqCUSlX_QhOaMMjc_aYiv>

- Get help from Google Assistant for certain actions. When that happens,  
relevant Assistant settings, like Personal Results, apply. Learn  
more<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5qIYB0kML0Y_qgLLJRHsj0lWwUYTy3yUYGfBsnwUzVIBhxTZCstKFDXzC55wxSM9ura6YNsT7aa7QmvhDXzigxkHE9YmjblCLBqNx5BpmvFKM2IJeNIihq39Z5byVpvoYYcaQCz1XqWoqJ4hI18Gb2S6W_gTP81aKjJ-cYO1zaGNCuovzuZKnOxCNvyVJo>

As a reminder, Gemini Apps are new and evolving. Theyâ€™re a part of our  
effort to develop LLMs responsibly, and Google is committed to working to  
improve over time. Learn  
more<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5oC1znPUJVwnxF0_c7haQAlx7rwgF9kpMzrx-bkwx5uSbNknQoRv8ODfZTbY5oMJZOmsniq1Wc-rZQfmyvaFwYrp_nkJ06IrUUnBj5R1h2FaBMoIRVSoV_uMwFt97JkBYGBDkpW_qUSATeW99GytPkSZFB0lQ>.


Google  
Terms<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5pyqQNrHjcHUGmvN26oDwPIZ8fkgXGXsoGGUYHnzhPuLNkSm9Abv9dI6G8DwJoaWds8hXLXrxY93bI_xjrlhoaiIu2tLnDRB6FZJ9sK4kTUPEKFCKVddZnuGcGeEVQG2Enl0YEPkixd_M8>  
apply to Gemini  
Apps<https://notifications.google.com/g/p/ANiao5r7qYd4UDNoyY5DLSdZgIbVV4DrRzDXTZ7UzHWAfa7Z1DEnFZhpDpd4bJ5lvkFZ6pLhMAcVPg6hKP-XkZ_B-bdLAyyTg7_pShuELlOww9g_2Y3tiNjDfY09As0iYm6txqWpHij-uJ6Nng9EzIWReLB6mW1JbN9syzSeD1XgaEELWvE8d0xGfecfwPnSKCqK96lUEuJNoudCQeptjSV5Az-Jjjv918EafsahFQDWRw>.  
Google will process your children's data as described in the Google Privacy

subject: SIVY ON STOCK - Whirlybird
body:
********************[ A D V E R T I S E M E N T ]**************** 
Stay on top of the market with Prudential Securities and 
Dow Jones. Click on the url below to learn how you can receive 
a 1-year subscription to The Wall Street Journal or 
BARRON'S, FREE! http://www.money.com/prudentialsecurities 
***************************************************************** 

SIVY ON STOCKS from money.com 
November 17, 2000

Whirlybird

With the outlook so uncertain, it's time to hunt for value. And Textron, a 
conglomerate that makes Cessna airplanes and Bell helicopters, fills the bill.

By Michael Sivy

The outcome of the election is still uncertain. So are the Fed's intentions 
for interest rates. And the economy is the most uncertain of all. In such an 
investing climate, it makes a lot of sense to add a little ballast to your 
portfolio, in the form of value stocks. One of the most attractive picks 
today is the industrial conglomerate ( [ 
http://quote.money.com/money/quote/qc?symbols=TXT ] )Textron. 

Conglomerates are often penalized because analysts like companies they can 
fit into specific industry groups. And Textron is tough to pigeonhole. The 
company gets 40 percent of its operating earnings from industrial businesses; 
30 percent from aircraft manufacturing, including Cessna airplanes and Bell 
helicopters; 19 percent from automotive, and 11 percent from financial 
services. 
?
It's a broad mix, but all together, the pieces are producing solid results. 
The aircraft division is flying highest, with revenue up 22 percent and 
profits up 40 percent in the third quarter. The outlook is quite bright, with 
order backlogs rising modestly for both Cessna airplanes and Bell 
helicopters, and profit margins improving slightly. Prospects are also 
attractive for the smallest division, financial services. 
?
The other two divisions have been performing much less impressively because 
of the developing economic slowdown. Automotive showed only a 1 percent 
revenue gain in the third quarter. And though the industrial division managed 
15 percent revenue growth in the quarter, income actually decreased 2 
percent. In addition to the weak economy, a spate of recent acquisitions has 
temporarily depressed that division's profitability. 
?
Textron expects the economy to remain sluggish going into 2001. So to bolster 
its results -- particularly for the industrial division -- Textron is 
developing an extensive cost-cutting and restructuring plan to be implemented 
over the next five quarters. Moreover, Textron has been steadily repurchasing 
stock and intends to continue doing so. Because the price is so low -- the 
stock is down 30 percent year-to-date -- those buybacks can contribute 
significantly to growth in earnings per share. 
?
For the third quarter, total earnings per share rose 14 percent. And with its 
restructuring plans, Textron aims to maintain that rate over the next five 
years. Currently the stock yields 2.4 percent, so Textron shareholders have a 
good shot at a total return averaging as much as 16 percent annually. 

Given those return prospects -- which beat both the market's long-term 
average and the current outlook for the S&P 500 -- Textron looks like a 
compelling choice for conservative investors. With a lot of exposure to 
manufacturing, this conglomerate won't be immune to a prolonged economic 
slowdown. But forecasts assume at least some sluggish economic patches and 
the valuation is tough to beat. At $53.25 a share, the stock trades at 11.4 
times this year's estimated earnings and only about 10 times next year's 
projected results. There are electric utilities offering only half the growth 
that trade for more.



###
Post your comments on Michael's column at: 
http://www.money.com/depts/investing/sivy/index.html

subject: Creativity, unstacked
body:
View this post on the web at https://read.substack.com/p/creativity-unstacked

â€œâ€‹Creativityâ€ is a word so overused, itâ€™s easy to forget what it actually means. But as a new year begins, letâ€™s reclaim creativity for what it truly isâ€”something beyond skill or intellect. Itâ€™s about perspective. Itâ€™s what creates great symphonies and novels, striking magazine covers and memorable billboard designs, but itâ€™s also a mindset: one that dares to think differently, to step beyond the expected.
Iâ€™ve previously written about creativity as a religious experience [ https://substack.com/redirect/1e396379-21fa-4b15-85a8-10b105ffd1cf?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], one where you transcend your sense of self and feel at one with a greater whole. Whether itâ€™s designing unique ceramics [ https://substack.com/@meshandcloth/note/c-87442186?utm_source=notes-share-action&r=48ea6r ], crafting a new recipe [ https://substack.com/redirect/1c1ce261-9c45-4a4a-a1ba-be735fd21de1?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], or launching a Substack [ https://substack.com/@mariaguavargas/note/c-88169932?utm_source=notes-share-action&r=48ea6r ], exploring the oft-forgotten creative parts of ourselves can make us feel less anxious and more fulfilled. Consider these insights an invitation to rediscover your creative spark.
Find inspiration
Creation begins with that sacred, slippery aha moment. Moments of inspiration often follow admiration [ https://substack.com/redirect/206da4f5-f89a-4ee4-99fe-be8e788907c3?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]: â€œNotice who you admire,â€ says Isabel . â€œOur sources of inspiration are our guides. They take us towards our magic. They show us where to look to find our gifts.â€ That moment of resonance is â€œthe universe winking at us, a flicker of our own magic catching our eye.â€
Finding resonance can be more passive than you might think. Inspired by Rick Rubinâ€™s The Creative Act, Rosie Peacock  reframes creativity as a process of listening rather than forcing [ https://substack.com/redirect/9aad37f5-a99b-4ebf-bc20-920e13c282bc?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]: â€œCreative inspiration is something already present in the worldâ€”like a signal waiting to be received. The creatorâ€™s role isnâ€™t to strain for ideas but to attune themselves to this frequency and let it flow through them.â€
Inspiration isnâ€™t fully in your control, which is why it happens when youâ€™re not trying too hard. When youâ€™re distracted [ https://substack.com/redirect/350606de-ffca-4643-908f-eb553cc4c95e?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], dreaming [ https://substack.com/redirect/555dcbdd-5f56-4aff-ae60-d6070cf3cce0?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], or just taking it slow [ https://substack.com/@sandysanchez/note/c-86073112 ]â€”thatâ€™s when the lightbulb ideas happen.
Go for a long walk
As Iâ€™ve said before, long walks are the midwives of good ideas [ https://substack.com/@sherryning/note/c-50746532 ]. The ancients called it solvitur ambulando, Latin for â€œit is solved by walking.â€ In postcards by elle , she writes [ https://substack.com/redirect/d439834c-8498-4b37-8d74-afc56e4e8b88?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], â€œin the open solitude, the frequency of your thoughts begin to change, and something that didnâ€™t make sense, the gray areas clouding your head, presents itself with an answer in startling technicolor.â€
Nietzsche, who walked five to seven hours a day, agreed: â€œOnly ideas won by walking have any value,â€ Jash Dholani  quotes [ https://substack.com/redirect/6d2756c5-b60b-4b37-852d-cfb4f7d456b3?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ] him as saying.
For inspiration, take a look at the scenes that have inspired your (digitally) local creators. And if you need more guidance, try asking yourself these six questions [ https://substack.com/redirect/897057d5-86c0-4c3b-b650-063c901407a7?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ] next time youâ€™re on your feet.
>From left, photos by Tom Cox [ https://substack.com/@tomcox/note/c-85652716? ], Benjamin Parry [ https://substack.com/@benparry/note/c-82025074?utm_source=notes-share-action&r=1gqmc9 ], and Chris Arnade [ https://substack.com/redirect/d69d8d10-01bb-4638-b293-e3e69303ab03?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]
Connect with other artistsâ€¦
Host a collage night [ https://substack.com/@kikamack/note/c-87198996 ], or a â€œfriendsidencyâ€ [ https://substack.com/redirect/113b082e-8125-4e75-be0f-0c4c62419d29?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ] Ã  la Anna Brones  to build deeper connections centered around creative pursuits. Use art as a vessel for gathering, because â€œevery idea needs a little breathing room, and if they only sit in the stuffy, closed-up space of our own minds, they wonâ€™t get it.â€
When Maya C. Popa  reflected on her vision for the Conscious Writers Collective [ https://substack.com/redirect/265ffd34-18d9-49e1-8dda-51aabd144afb?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], a place where writers connect with each other, she said, â€œI often think of T.S. Eliotâ€™s assertion that all literature is happening simultaneously, which makes me feel a deep and numinous connection.â€
â€¦but also make time for solitude (and boredom)
When we talk about creativity, itâ€™s often about artâ€”that primitive process of turning individual perception into expression. And your creative self also needs silence to be heard.
Inspired by Julia Cameronâ€™s The Artistâ€™s Way, Elif Batuman  encourages her studentsâ€”and herselfâ€”to go on artist dates [ https://substack.com/redirect/3c99d5e7-ce5f-4f12-afac-a311c3556c5e?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]: â€œa block of time, perhaps two hours weekly, especially set aside and committed to nurturing your creative consciousness, your inner artist.â€
Thatâ€™s what Jean Iversen  did before starting her three-year MFA program in creative nonfiction. She stayed at a secluded resort in New Mexico, where she found the magic of silence and nothingness [ https://substack.com/redirect/e96dd818-fae2-42ec-af62-a46dad08ae9c?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]. The desert is â€œa place I know Iâ€™ll return to when I need to be still. When I need to feel the spaces, in between the echoes.â€
Another way to be more in tune with your creative intuition is to doâ€¦ nothing. This is what Erik Torenberg  calls perfect rest [ https://substack.com/redirect/9b735072-4c10-4630-bc8c-30c01a4d010d?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]: â€œWant new ideas? Spend one full day alone doing nothing. Want to be more in touch with yourself? Spend one full day alone doing nothing.â€ Not even meditatingâ€”just sitting there. â€œ100% not judging the process.â€
And if doing nothing makes you bored, that might be a good thing. Suleika Jaouad  talks about the expansiveness of that feeling of nothingness [ https://substack.com/redirect/7e4874a0-e738-46d8-b64f-4256c6df6fcc?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]: â€œThe times when Iâ€™ve been forced to lie fallow have spurred me toward the most fertile creative periods of my life.â€
Ignore creativity advice
Maybe thereâ€™s no formula for creativity at all. Maybe you just need to learn the rules of the game and break them your own way, as in Henry Oliver â€™s reminder to ignore writing advice [ https://substack.com/redirect/e7d975a7-f3c7-45c4-bf3b-ac6e287f3459?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]. Or, as Henrik Karlsson  says about befriending your curiosity [ https://substack.com/redirect/fdedf39c-f6dc-452d-b2be-6b29ec0456f2?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], you donâ€™t need creative guidance; you just need to follow whatâ€™s fun and interesting. And if you donâ€™t like what comes out of it, you can always rip it up and start again [ https://substack.com/redirect/223fb80b-29fe-47bd-9325-bf8a56e835bc?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ], like Alice Bowsher .
Log off [ https://substack.com/@gurwinder/note/c-86328613?utm_source=notes-share-action&r=1gqmc9 ]. Touch grass [ https://substack.com/@amandaclairevesty/note/c-85523814 ]. Get some ZZZs [ https://substack.com/@gracevanvranken/note/c-86544527 ] (itâ€™s okay to rest [ https://substack.com/redirect/2420c7ed-b401-42eb-bc20-c1f1239bb76f?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]). Go on a picnic [ https://substack.com/@annaseirian/note/c-85502884 ]. Bake something delicious [ https://substack.com/@nickisizemore/note/c-84592148 ]. Cuddle a sheep [ https://substack.com/@theolivetreesandthemoon/note/c-85687060 ].
And if all else fails, remember: â€œIn order to be an artist, the first thing you have to do is make some art.â€ [ https://substack.com/redirect/7c4963f1-e2ed-4923-be9c-9c09b3c66a8b?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ] Consider this your invitation to get started.

Unsubscribe https://substack..lbTbK5HEeCh7whVaasxo9nA1MF5ZbGzH20v7JLY7_iI?

subject: Karen Yeh recommend
body:
Good morning,


Liz and I are Karen Yehâ€™s clients and parents of 3 girls under the age of
12. We are looking to better educate our family on nutritional health (what
to eat, how much, how often, good habits/bad habits), and Karen mentioned
that we reach out to you.


Please let us know when you may be around to talk it would be great to chat
and understand how you could help


Thanks!

subject: Re: KILN
body:
Awesome - Iâ€™m looking to do a cone 10 firing for a few of the pieces I sent (the 7 that are a pinkish bisque).

When are you available?
________________________________
From: sasha ramirez <user_a89cb4b3@example.com>
Sent: Monday, December 16, 2024 5:14:16 PM
To: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com>
Subject: Re: KILN

Hello Matthew,

Yes itâ€™s available.

Best,

 Sasha R.

On Dec 16, 2024, at 16:21, Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com> wrote:

ï»¿
Hello - although itâ€™s been over a year, I am almost ready to start firing a bunch of pieces for some New Yearâ€™s gifts, and was wondering if you still have a kiln and capacity!

Here is everything (unglazed)

Please let me know, and thanks in advance!
________________________________
From: sasha ramirez <user_a89cb4b3@example.com>
Sent: Friday, July 21, 2023 1:33:49 AM
To: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com>
Subject: Re: KILN

Hello Matthew,

 So sorry for the late response, for some reason this email went to my spam.
   It's a very exciting thing! Everything depends on how many pieces and how big they are. Do you have an idea of what it is you are looking to fire?

On Tue, Jul 18, 2023 at 10:27â€¯AM Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>> wrote:
Hello.

My nameâ€™s Matt, Im just getting started on my ceramics journey, and have been looking to fire some pieces I recently slipcast. I saw your flyer about kiln time at Ceramic Supply, and would love to understand more about how you generally operate.

Thanks in advance
-Matt

subject: RE: NJ Mediation consult - Hanson divorce
body:
Liz and Matt:

Thanks for reaching out, of course Iâ€™d be happy to help and appreciate the opportunity to do so.

We can speak on the phone (or Zoom), perhaps early next week.

Iâ€™d assume we could have an initial discussion without Jenny and Joanna (with their permission, of course).

Let me know what day(s) might work for you both.

Thanks, I look forward to meeting you both.

Mark

Mark P. Marotta, Esq.
Marotta & Tuchman, LLC.
[ADDRESS_REDACTED]
Suite 320
Maywood, New Jersey, 07607

Ph. [PHONE_REDACTED]
Fx. [PHONE_REDACTED]
user_27760fc5@example.com<mailto:user_27760fc5@example.com>
www.kkmtlegal.com<http://www.kkmtlegal.com/>



From: liz <user_97aa7745@example.com>
Sent: Friday, June 7, 2024 1:11 PM
To: Mark Marotta <user_27760fc5@example.com>
Cc: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com>; Jenny Birz <user_e5596704@example.com>; user_6b9fb6d0@example.com
Subject: NJ Mediation consult - Hanson divorce

Hi Mark,

My husband and I have started the divorce process and are looking for a mediator to facilitate next steps. You were recommended by both of our lawyers (cc'd here). We're currently completing CIS forms with their guidance.

Please let us know if you are taking on new clients at this time and when you might be available for a call to discuss? I am out of town next week but back online by 6/17.

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Liz Hanson [PHONE_REDACTED]
Matt Hanson [PHONE_REDACTED]

RHODA SCOTT
https://waxpoetics.com/products/issue-7-vol-2?mc_cid=088f110114&mc_eid=UNIQID

Rhoda Scott was born July 3, 1938, in Dorothy, New Jersey, as the eldest girl in a family of seven children. Like so many Black jazz musicians from this period, the church (in her case an African Methodist Episcopal church where her father, the Rev. Winfred Scott, was the minister and a reported master of Black homiletics) occupied a central place of social and musical development. From the perch of her motherâ€™s knee, Scott learned church repertoire as if by osmosis.

â€œMy parents always told me that I would come back home and play what my mother had just played in church,â€ she told bassist Christian McBride on a July [ADDRESS_REDACTED] of NPRâ€™s Jazz Night in America. And while Scott would ultimately incorporate gestures of the French chanson into her singular style, it was the hymns, sacred liturgical music, and the African American spiritual that would form a sort of lingua franca for not only Scott, but for generations of Black musicians.

- Extract from â€˜The Barefoot Ladyâ€™ written by Andrew Scott.
READ MORE HERE IN ISSUE 7 (https://waxpoetics.com/products/issue-7-vol-2?mc_cid=088f110114&mc_eid=UNIQID)

Steven Julien featuring Fatima

London-based producer Steven Julien has announced his new EP, Wraapâ€™t, set for release on September 13th via Apron Records. In the meantime, heâ€™s blessed us with the title track, featuring the soulful vocals of Swedish singer Fatima.

** Patrice Rushen

Prelusion is the debut album by iconic recording artist Patrice Rushen, originally released on Prestige Records in 1974. Showcasing the sounds of Post-Bop and Jazz Fusion, the album features contributions from legendary saxophonist Joe Henderson. Reissued on vinyl for the first time in 50 years as part of Jazz Dispensaryâ€™s Top Shelf series, it was cut from the original analog tapes by Kevin Gray.

Spring Has Sprung

The beautiful track, â€œSpring Has Sprung,â€ is a collaboration between the legendary artist Asha Puthli, the band SOYUZ, and Swedish maestro Sven Wunder. The song is available now, and the full record is available for pre-order, with an early October release date.

View this post on the web at https://nlp.elvissaravia.com/p/ai-agents-weekly-perplexitys-deep

In todayâ€™s issue:
Perplexityâ€™s Deep Research is here
Tips for Building Agents
Best Practices for OpenAI o-series Models
Agentic AI Systems Applied to Finance
Postman has launched their new AI Agent Builder
DeepHermes 3 Preview combines normal LLM response modes with reasoning capabilities
Improving how AI agents work together, LlamaDeploy, and more.
Top Stories
Perplexity Deep Research Agent
Perplexity launches Deep Research, a new AI-powered research assistant that conducts comprehensive analysis by performing dozens of searches and reading hundreds of sources. 
The tool is being made available for free to all users, with Pro subscribers getting 500 queries per day while non-subscribers receive a limited number of queries per day. Perplexitâ€™s Deep Research is currently available on the Web, with iOS, Android, and Mac releases coming soon.
The system leverages iterative search and reasoning capabilities to create detailed reports across various domains including finance, marketing, technology, and health.
 Perplexity reports that Deep Research achieves a 20.5% accuracy score on Humanity's Last Exam and 93.9% on the SimpleQA benchmark, outperforming other leading models like Gemini Thinking and o1. Most research tasks are completed in under 3 minutes, with results exportable to PDF or shareable as Perplexity Pages.
Blog [ https://substack.com/redirect/c6f38fed-ce89-498f-8cdf-3553dce36c12?j=eyJ1IjoicWljdSJ9.EPuowD212iV9gYOWdRrTDMoBmG67gAUi7iA0NpcJzes ]

Hi Matthew,


We all know that fresh produce at your local farmers market looks and tastes better — but it’s not just the quality.


Every decision to shop local means fewer emissions associated with shipping and holding the produce in cold storage and a better connection with where your food comes from.


Whether you frequent your farmers market or join a CSA (community supported agriculture) to get weekly or monthly farm-fresh boxes of food, you’re supporting local farmers 👩‍🌾, strengthening communities 🤝 and helping our planet 🌎.

 



https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d4868942216e0b9a8a4d809bff686190134f5d3d980c695c0403ab6449139ac1d3768d4b62ba1e133df222c2eb46fbfa072e90d5221b723695921f3ae 
This summer, pledge to support local farmers and shop local! 

And Matthew, if you 
https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d4868942216e0b9a8a4d809bff686190134f5d3d980c695c0403ab6449139ac1d3768d4b62ba1e133df222c2eb46fbfa072e90d5221b723695921f3ae 
take the pledge  during the month of August, you will be entered for a chance to win up to $500 towards a local farmers market or a CSA farm box program, thanks to the California Volunteers Fund!

 


https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d4868942216e0b9a8a4d809bff686190134f5d3d980c695c0403ab6449139ac1d3768d4b62ba1e133df222c2eb46fbfa072e90d5221b723695921f3ae 
Pledge to Shop Local 


Supporting local farmers is one of 10 priority actions for 
https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d486894224006396517ca667713873a8a55a251ef76df4780f3fed99fadbb4f2b273c5fd0bae4d3fa90090701fd29726c6c8eb28c85a2fb21902d9719 
Climate Action Counts , our statewide effort mobilizing Californians to take simple, everyday actions for a collective impact on the fight to combat climate change.


Eating California-grown foods reduces your carbon footprint and supports your community. (California also has some of the best food and produce in the world!) 
https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d486894226f1648c16d34bffd7f260491d8c82cb8b8ec27773de731889f5420d3b674a50cfdb2745c2925fb3f0c95603cd3d1f358a22bf13db1751815 
Watch our video to learn more. 

https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d4868942216e0b9a8a4d809bff686190134f5d3d980c695c0403ab6449139ac1d3768d4b62ba1e133df222c2eb46fbfa072e90d5221b723695921f3ae 
So take the pledge this month to shop local, support local farmers and possibly win up to $500 towards a local farmers market or CSA farm box program! 

https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=9650d30d48689422a5824d1dd1f24f54c7f433e57df827c3e6ae51cddef4b28bc8547e28f49b46b21068cece49e6f7d6a6dd0807afcdbb5fc80d40b8ed63bde1 
Search here to find a farm, farmers market or food hub near you. 


In Service,


California Volunteers, Office of the Governor

 







https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=b097b305817ac40b5dbc51b65972b711ee66eccf5e41cde9d005e0e90bbbce33c292fa6147d9cffca464204e50c7cb288107584a5188279e88ce02732ae26931 
California Volunteers , under 
https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=b097b305817ac40bd1b05c1934cbec4f2786ebb1dbca00df94ff749b4d4fd2249d879265d798e1b557ff9c8ce8dd510f85dfb7bc71c54cb3959c55de2a6fbd2f 
GO-Serve , empowers Californians to take action to improve their communities. California Volunteers is the state office tasked with recruiting Californians to engage in public service.




https://click.email.californiavolunteers.ca.gov/?qs=b097b305817ac40b3d7aea5755727decdb9a3ea32c5d0ce48aa12aedd4f01d732a5cafd01bfe79f0671d37dd0f592963e5f16ece6235dd04b523ee2b10d4da41

subject: Breathe easy this season with help from Dignity Health-GoHealth Urgent Care
body:
GoHealth Urgent Care
 
 

https://click.info.gohealthuc.com/?qs=7b78927b4ee6e0c0de3cc447f8d3dcca1a35d1331bc18a2078b1386ef3182c57bcc8feb83b5f09a1f48b081ead38e663e714f28913d45bc1bff829827bbe84d0 





 

 
 
https://click.info.gohealthuc.com/?qs=f85e6c212dba6d6e27fb1f31edd440a53f8c0ab0058945b0d7350a896ec269bbcc030c922f128aaebb7cd38d2168a5dadc1e87a7af1cb5c7584f953cba7961d9 

 

Seasonal allergies have you running for the tissues? Take back the season and let Dignity Health-GoHealth Urgent Care help you get your allergies under control. With the right treatment plan, we can help you put pollen in its place so you can get back to enjoying this beautiful season.
 


https://click.info.gohealthuc.com/?qs=f85e6c212dba6d6e27fb1f31edd440a53f8c0ab0058945b0d7350a896ec269bbcc030c922f128aaebb7cd38d2168a5dadc1e87a7af1cb5c7584f953cba7961d9 
Save your spot → 

 


https://click.info.gohealthuc.com/?qs=f85e6c212dba6d6e27fb1f31edd440a53f8c0ab0058945b0d7350a896ec269bbcc030c922f128aaebb7cd38d2168a5dadc1e87a7af1cb5c7584f953cba7961d9 

 

Playing sports has benefits for all ages. But kids are often more susceptible to injury. To stay safe this spring: get a sports physical, follow the game rules, stretch, drink water, rest and most importantly, enjoy the game.

If an injury happens, weâ€™re open
after practice, 7 days a week.
 

 

https://click.info.gohealthuc.com/?qs=f85e6c212dba6d6e27fb1f31edd440a53f8c0ab0058945b0d7350a896ec269bbcc030c922f128aaebb7cd38d2168a5dadc1e87a7af1cb5c7584f953cba7961d9

Learn more →

subject: Prompt of the week: Format my slide with AI
body:
Try reformatting your existing slide decks with Plus AI

( https://plusdocs.com )

***********************
Format my slides for me
***********************

We just released *five new presentation templates* for Plus AI, and you can use them to reformat your existing slides.

One of my favorite ways to use Remix is to paste and article or *jot rough notes on a slide and then let Plus AI handle the formatting*.

Here's an example of how to *Remix an existing PowerPoint slide* using one of our new slide templates.

Prompt of the week

* Type notes onto slide
* Click Edit with AI -> Select Remix
* Choose template and slide format
* Click Remix Slide

Here's a link to the example slide deck ( https://plusdocs-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/p/dan/EYCv544_yVFFgAIFctwD7AoBARcpim35miGiPOoo1SGzEw?e=KgBuKr ).

Get Plus AI ( https://www.plusdocs.com/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=cta_button )

-------------------------
How do I install Plus AI?
-------------------------

It's easy to use Plus AI in Google Slides ( https://workspace.google.com/marketplace/app/plus_ai_for_google_slides/21[PHONE_REDACTED] ) or PowerPoint ( https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200007130?tab=Overview ). Click on the Extensions or Add-ins menu and search for Plus AI.

------------------------------
What else is new with Plus AI?
------------------------------

* *PowerPoint memes* ( https://www.plusdocs.com/blog/powerpoint-memes ) - We curated a fun collection of memes you can use in your next presentation
* *Christmas marketing plan* ( https://www.instagram.com/reel/DDPN9Y0pjEJ/?hl=en ) ** - Fastppt made a cool demo of how to use Plus AI to create a marketing plan
* *AI image generator* ( https://www.plusdocs.com/features/ai-image-generator ) ** - Learn more about our new AI image generation capabilities

---------------
Want more help?
---------------

Learn more about Plus AI in our guide ( https://guide.plusdocs.com/plus-ai/plus-ai-for-google-slides-and-docs ) , or visit our FAQ ( https://www.plusdocs.com/pricing ) to get answers to commonly asked questions.

Plus logo ( http://www.plusdocs.com )

subject: =?UTF-8?Q?Affirmations_to_Help_Kids_Talk_Back_to_Anxiety_=F0=9F=92=AC?=
body:
and how to make kids practice themThe other night, my kiddo couldnâ€™t fall asleep.Â  Â  She was anxious about a new camp she was starting. You know the drillâ€”racing thoughts, wide eyes, and a whispered: Â Â  **â€œWhat if none of my friends are there?â€ â€œWhat if itâ€™s awful?â€** Â  The spiral was in full swing. Then something magical happened. Something Iâ€™ve gently encouraged for a while. Something Iâ€™ve modeled, but never seen her try on her own. Â  She whispered: **â€œAnxiety, I see youâ€”but Iâ€™m safe right now.â€ â€œI can handle this.â€** Â  And just like that, there was a small shift. A moment of peace. Â  If youâ€™ve ever watched your kids struggle with anxious thoughts, this new resource is for you: Â  👉 Download the 30-Day Affirmation Challenge PDF https://gostrengthsftp.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/Printables/GoZenPrintables_30DayAffirmationChallenge.pdf Â (A check-off challenge kids can use anytime) https://gostrengthsftp.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/Printables/GoZenPrintables_30DayAffirmationChallenge.pdf A little skeptical of affirmations? Youâ€™re not alone. Take a deep dive into why this works and get some extra affirmations: 👉 Read the full blog post: Why Positive Self-Talk Works for Anxiety https://gozen.com/52-affirmations-for-kids-with-anxiety-make-positive-self-talk-a-daily-habit/ Thank you for being awesome, Renee Jain Founder of GoZen! Masters of Applied Positive Psychology University of Pennsylvania gozen.com P.S. We'd love to see you on Insta where we're putting unique content -- follow usÂ here https://www.instagram.com/gozenlove/. :) Every week we send out social and emotional learning tools to help raise a generation of resilient kids and teens. If you no longer want to receive these emails, you canÂ unsubscribe http://mail.gozen.com/proc.php?nl=1&c=1573&m=1525&s=60bb731fe497cce1399d3883280a1503&act=unsubÂ here.Â We will miss you! Sent from:Â GoStrengths Inc.
[ADDRESS_REDACTED] Suite 300
Vero Beach, FL 32960
United States

subject: Status - week ending March 24
body:
THIS MESSAGE IS BEING SENT OUT ON BEHALF OF GREG NIKKEL AND KIM LESLEY


Below is a summary of our activities this past week

Accomplishments:
Delivered workshops at NEPCO
Gained agreement with NEPCO on status of showstopper reports
Scheduled India' s workshops for next week
Rolled out (to NEPCO) the user manuals developed


Upcoming:
Complete gathering of data points and begin to layout longer term strategy 
(Elaine and Kim)
Develop additional workshops (design and data flow, consolidations and 
intercompany)
Develop and deliver second evaluation
Roll out manuals to user group in Houston 


Where are we at?
We should be able to ask more specific questions in our follow up evaluation 
to get better data on what specifically they don't like about the reporting 
out of SAP but as a rule so far we have consistently heard the issue of 
management quality reports, ability to pull data from across modules (ie. HR 
and PS data) and I can't get the data the way I want to see it therefore I 
don't understand what the data is telling me. 

This last point will be helped by these workshops (ability to view the data 
in mulitple ways) but only to the extent where people use the tools available 
and spend a little time to work with the system.  The design sessions 
(upcoming) should help address some of these questions aswell - one big 
learning from this has been that the majority of users do not understand 
their business unit design or the overall design and therefore can't figure 
out what the system data is telling them.  This is being addressed in the 7/1 
training plan and will also be addressed in the long term reporting strategy.

Thanks, again if you have any questions please contact Melissa, Greg or 
myself.

Kim Lesley

subject: Coparenting Record â€“ May 17 Pickup
body:
Below is a message I sent to Liz this morning on OFW. Sending to you for posterity.



Hi Liz,


Iâ€™m writing to document the events of this morning as part of an ongoing effort to create a clear record of our co-parenting challenges.


I arrived at the house at 10am. Clara was ready to go, and Charlie came out shortly after. We waited for Colette for about 10 minutes. You then arrived, having just returned from walking the dog, and Colette was not yet ready. About 10 minutes later, you brought her out to the car visibly upset and hysterically crying (let me know if I need to get the nest cam footage).


What followed was unfortunately consistent with past experiences: Colette had a severe panic episode in the car. She was screaming, crying, and attempting to get out of the vehicle, making it impossible for me to safely lock the doors. We spent another 5â€“10 minutes trying to help her calm down while remaining parked outside the house.


Even after we began driving, Colette remained hysterical and nonverbal, continuing to cry and make distressing sounds for the entire ride. When we arrived at the diner, I let Clara and Charlie out and stayed with Colette in the car for about five minutes to help her regain composure. At that point, we also realized she had been brought out of the house without shoes on. She was eventually able to join us inside, but this level of emotional distress has now become a pattern and deeply concerns me. Despite over a year of therapy, weâ€™ve seen little to no progress in helping her with transitions.


I also learned this morning that Clara has made plans to return to the house at 6pm to see her boyfriend. I was not made aware of a decision with this plan, and I was surprised to hear it had been approved without any coordination with me. This makes it difficult to plan meaningful time with the girls and doesnâ€™t reflect the kind of communication and mutual respect I believe weâ€™re both trying to model.


Iâ€™m sharing this to document the situation clearly and with the hope that we can find better ways to support Colette and create a more structured and respectful approach to shared time and decision-making.


Iâ€™ll continue to send messages like this to log any issues as they arise.


Best,

Matt

Book an appointment 

[ADDRESS_REDACTED] 10 or 15 minutes. You can do anything for 10-15 minutes, right?

Start anywhere

Find an accountability buddy

Ask a colleague, friend, or family member to check in on your progress.

Feeling stuck? Take a break

Stepping away for a bit can give your brain the reset it needs to start again.

Warm, Buttery Polenta with Flavor-Packed Toppings
http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7ee2bd693dde7dcb5ba7d2a8405b1858b956e1954783e1edfef13cd7aea6bdcda8364001f3f746875fae611a58bf6114c09d7703ad17a472e 

http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7ee2bd693dde7dcb5ba7d2a8405b1858b956e1954783e1edfef13cd7aea6bdcda8364001f3f746875fae611a58bf6114c09d7703ad17a472e 
Lan Lam

Deputy Food Editor, Cook’s Illustrated

When youâ€™re in need of a speedy, satisfying supper, thereâ€™s nothing handier than polentaâ€”if, that is, you know our strategies for making it quick and easy to whip up. Read on for my streamlined recipe for the lush, subtly nutty porridge, as well as a trio of toppings to suit any mood.


Polentaâ€™s soothing creaminess develops when the pectin holding the cornâ€™s cells together softens and the starch inside the cells swells with water and becomes tender. But that can take as long as an hour. To hurry the process, you can give the pectin a head start. A pinch of baking soda releases sodium ions that displace some of the calcium that holds the pectin in place, softening it quickly and allowing the golden porridge to be prepared in just 30 minutes.

Polenta is typically whisked or stirred as it bubbles on the stovetop. Patient, persistent agitation pushes the grains away from the heat and keeps them moving relative to each other. Otherwise, high heat at the bottom of the pot causes corn particles to adhere to the cookware; then, more corn bonds to that gluey mass, creating a thick, clumpy layer.

The good news is that you can also prevent sticking by lowering the flame as much as possible after the mixture comes to a boil. Now you have a virtually hands-free meal base in only half an hour. 
http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7ad45eaf0c1e1d116a8654cebcacf5aa4e084e62f5e7c472befaa1a92c3706544650df167eb1542dee793fc2c0a9a9fe14a2056d6179cfb29 
Discover the secret to a quick and easy dish with toppings to suit any mood. →

http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e731edbdabdbe538fc64596f2404cb8e19c1eda77e173bd3c73e7019e571e9926acf3884847b8b14355d0a4f2e93648d4c9eb732ef0fa9d328 

FEATURED RECIPE
Creamy Polenta with Sausage and Peppers

Cozy up to creamy polenta in a lush weeknight meal topped with hearty sausages and peppers.

 


http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e731edbdabdbe538fc64596f2404cb8e19c1eda77e173bd3c73e7019e571e9926acf3884847b8b14355d0a4f2e93648d4c9eb732ef0fa9d328 
get the recipe

 

WHY THIS RECIPE WORKS
 

 

-Lush, hearty texture
Coarse-ground polenta offers slightly resilient grains interspersed in the creamy porridge.


 

-Speedier cooking
A pinch of baking soda speeds cooking by displacing calcium that holds the corn pectin in place, softening it quickly.


 

-Low-fuss method
Cooking over the lowest heat prevents the corn from sticking to the bottom of the pot, eliminating the need for continuous stirring.


RECIPE DEVELOPED BY Lan Lam
 


http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7ee2bd693dde7dcb5ba7d2a8405b1858b956e1954783e1edfef13cd7aea6bdcda8364001f3f746875fae611a58bf6114c09d7703ad17a472e 
Lan Lam Lan Lam is a Deputy Food editor of Cookâ€™s Illustrated, cast member of 

http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7caa0fc662ab4455359d0bc0ee5498e845cda6b0057ee9b3e919a37104725c67a9f78c0f988d2403a68b1004608fcacf3598e64e477f237da 
Americaâ€™s Test Kitchen, and the creator/host of the web series 

http://click.email.americastestkitchen.com/?qs=fef410ac823b26e7d6970970704a9e52a244d5adefb707cb448fd5090b85e421103cbe6f8c7fcf18233bed4a6e4fde7534f710c73b28ae58108e4ce79e900eef 
Techniquely with Lan Lam. Sheâ€™s a line cook turned recipe developer whose interest in the science of cooking was piqued while she studied chemistry at Wesleyan University. This grounding in scientific inquiry, in combination with the technical skills acquired in restaurant kitchens, helps her find new and creative approaches to cooking and baking.

body:

Y'er off the hook, matee.
---------------------- Forwarded by Paul Kaufman/PDX/ECT on 10/10/2000 09:09 
AM ---------------------------


Lysa Akin
10/09/2000 02:18 PM
To: Tim Belden/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jake Thomas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Christopher F 
Calger/PDX/ECT@ECT, Paul Kaufman/PDX/ECT@ECT, Mary Hain/HOU/ECT@ECT
cc: Debra Davidson/PDX/ECT@ECT, Mollie Gustafson/PDX/ECT@ECT, Jessica 
Burry/PDX/ECT@ECT 
Subject: Information re: Commissioner McIntyre

I have just been advised by Commissioner McIntyre's office that he will NOT 
be traveling to Portland this week.  Subsequently (obviously) he has 
cancelled his visit to the trading floor scheduled for Oct. 13th.  

We will try and coordinate with the Commissioner's office to arrange a visit 
at a later date.

Lysa
---------------------- Forwarded by Lysa Akin/PDX/ECT on 10/09/2000 02:22 PM 
---------------------------


Lysa Akin
09/28/2000 01:47 PM
To: Tim Belden/HOU/ECT@ECT, Jake Thomas/HOU/ECT@ECT, Christopher F 
Calger/PDX/ECT@ECT, Paul Kaufman/PDX/ECT
cc: Debra Davidson/PDX/ECT@ECT, Mollie Gustafson/PDX/ECT@ECT, Jessica 
Burry/PDX/ECT@ECT 
Subject: Information re: Commissioner McIntyre

As you know, I have been working with the Commissioner's office to arrange 
for Cmmr. McIntyre 
to tour the floor when he is in Portland the 12th & 13th of October.

Just to update you:

The Commr. is unavailable the 12th.  He will be in the office the 13th at 
2:00pm
Tim Belden has indicated that he is available the 13th, and I have reserved 
Mt. St. Helens in his name at 2:00pm.
Jake Thomas is out of country and cannot attend.
Chris Calger is out of the office the 13th and cannot attend.
Paul Kaufman is out of the office and cannot attend.

Tim, if you would like my assistance in planning the visit, please let me 
know!

Lysa
x7927

Lysa Akin
09/28/2000 01:31 PM
To: user_9d4e2e0a@example.us
cc:  
Subject: Directions/Instructions for Portland Trip

Cynthia - Here is a map from the hotel to the office.

From street level, Commissioner McIntyre will need to take the escalator at 
Three (3) World Trade Center up to the main entrance.

Inside the double doors is a guard desk.  He needs to sign in and get a Guest 
pass.  
They will ask him who he is here to see and he should advise Lysa Akin and 
give them my extension at 7927.

I will then come down and escort him to the floor.

Lysa Akin
Ass't to Paul Kaufman

subject: RE: Cleburne issues
body:
James, 

I just sent a message to Jeff Hodge asking how we can handle this.  I will let you know as soon as I hear something from him. (I left messages with him prior to today to discuss this deal.)

D

 -----Original Message-----
From: 	Armstrong, James  
Sent:	Friday, January 04, 2002 3:05 PM
To:	Farmer, Daren J.
Cc:	Olsen, Michael
Subject:	Cleburne issues

Daren, with Megan gone I just wanted to touch base with you on the status of the Enron payments owed to the Cleburne plant.  The current issues are as follows:

November Gas Sales					$600,377.50
October payment to ENA for TXU pipeline charges	$108,405.00
Cleburne receivable from Enron				$708,782.50

Less: November Gas Agency Fees			($54,000.00)

Net Cleburne Receivable from Enron			$654,782.50

Per my discussions with Megan, she stated that about $500K of the $600K Nov gas sales was intercompany (desk to desk) sales, with the remainder from TXU.  Are we able to settle any intercompany deals now? Are we able to settle with TXU?

Additionally, you'll see that I included the Oct TXU payment in the receivable owed to Cleburne also.  This is because I always pay Megan based upon the pipeline estimates in Michael's file, even though they are not finalized until the next month.  Therefore in my November payment to Enron, I paid ENA for October's estimate, of which Megan would have paid the final bill on 12/26/01 when it was finalized.  However, I had to pay the October bill directly last month, even though I had already sent the funds to ENA in November.  Therefore, I essentially paid this bill twice (once to ENA in Nov & once to TXU in Dec).  I deducted the November Agency Fees from these receivable totals to show the net amount owed to Cleburne.

Please advise as to the status of these bills.  You can reach me at [PHONE_REDACTED].  Thanks.

James

Dear Clients,
Due to unpredictable hardware failure, last night's migrations to Outlook had 
to be postponed. You ability to use email via your Lotus Notes client remains 
100% available at this time. The Outlook Migration Team will contact you to 
inform you of your re-scheduled date of migration. We apologize for the 
inconvenience this has caused you and thank you for your patience and 
understanding.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.
Sincerely,
Emmanuel

subject: Summer Starts with Hemp
body:
[Meet Hemp](https://www.taylorstitch.com/collections/the-hemp-shop?signup=0&utm_source=klaviyo&utm_medium=email&utm_content=a&utm_campaign=is_men_q225_hempspotlight&sv_svemi=2277[PHONE_REDACTED]&id=01JWYC7CFAEXH6XHHTE8TAHSQ1)

It softens with wear, holds its shape, and requires fewer resources to grow than conventional materials. subject: What Trump did in Michigan
body:
[ https://act.elissaslotkin.org/go/188?t=1001&akid=1833%2E3072907%2EHMYl2W ][IMG]

   I am sure you didn't wake up on this lovely Tuesday morning, spring out of bed and scream, "Today is the day I am going to donate to Elissa Slotkin to hold Michigan's Senate seat for Democrats!"

But I am emailing in the hope that you will consider contributing today anyway. Hereâ€™s why:

It is impossible to overstate the importance of entering the general election as strong as possible.

Michigan is going to be one of the closest, most competitive and expensive Senate races in the country this year. Recent polling shows a dead-heat in both the Senate and the Presidential races, which means we have two competitive elections to win. 

Donations a month or two from now â€“ when weâ€™re in the home stretch of the sprint â€“ are important. But to be frank, donations now, as we recently entered the 90 day window for the general election, are even more important. Because they allow us to execute a strategic plan for the general election that we've been preparing for months, rather than cobbling together a plan as donations come in piecemeal.

If holding the Senate for Democrats in this critical swing state is worth it to you, that is the donation I am asking you to make to my U.S. Senate campaign today. I would not ask if I didnâ€™t have a plan to use those resources TO WIN.

DONATE: https://act.elissaslotkin.org/go/2445?t=1002&akid=1833%2E3072907%2EHMYl2W

Thank you again for your continued support,

Elissa
   Â 
   

You can unsubscribe from this mailing list at any time:
http://act.elissaslotkin.org/cms/unsubscribe/unsubscribe/?akid=1833%2E3072907%2EHMYl2W

GM. This is Milk Road. The daily read thatâ€™s as satisfying as the first _click click_ of the BBQ tongs.

Hereâ€™s what we got for you today:

Caption: 

# **A MAKE OR BREAK MOMENT FOR MARKETS **ðŸ˜°

_â€œIf you had one shotâ€¦to seize everything you ever wantedâ€¦would you capture it, or just let it slip?â€_

â€“ Marshall Bruce Mathers The Third, 2002 AD.

â€˜Cool Eminem reference. Really poignant stuff. But how does it relate to crypto?â€™

(Thanks!) **And allow us to elaborateâ€¦Â **

Right now there are a few major, market-leading stocks and cryptocurrencies sitting at similar inflection points â€“ **NVIDIA, Coinbase, and Ethereum** are all at **make or break moments** within their long term trends! 

Meaning the outcome for each is likely going to be** one of two things:**

**Really bad **or **really good. **ðŸ‘€

Weâ€™re going to show you the charts, tell you what weâ€™re seeing, then **dig into the possible outcomes** â€“ ready? Good.

### **1/ NVIDIA ($NVDA)**

View image: (https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXd1Yh_GjZZE6yitaztDEyFWr-vwVkFzkdy0U7Nq-ayn9IvSZJbeTjojsFQVRoCHs2U4rNTxV3zVzXsCI8PGN9k_uv9iQVdHPWTMkR9hp2PSeXIBWfEzj94H1PxUQU4GdmWdnk4SkTb7VRGDzt3kQVuWWD5c?key=c1Sm70ZlVj6dx1YBQu3Ehg)
Follow image link: (https://www.tradingview.com/)
Caption: Source: TradingView

NVIDIA is about to touch an **upward trendline** that it has been following since late 2022.Â 

It already touched it once when marketâ€™s tanked in early August, and is looking like itâ€™s **about to retest.**

The bullish news: NVIDIA has (so far) had a habit of double-tapping its trendline **then launching** (see how itâ€™s done it twice already?).

### **2/ Coinbase ($COIN)**

View image: (https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXcPXXFaSXFDRdoL_VBwvU9wQQyLCX6-yxB-eaYrjBmeD340upzTmfg5H1RN13B5ooivvVrziy6KeQ_OCJnbjSzKLqtbhbPni3QWYN4ieTVSOVf2izZUK0oR15iNoi3jccYHlYf67G4H4AS1CY2M3RiGwRDV?key=c1Sm70ZlVj6dx1YBQu3Ehg)
Follow image link: (https://www.tradingview.com/)
Caption: Source: TradingView

Coinbase didnâ€™t quite touch its long term trendline after Augustâ€™s crash, but recently succeeded on its** second attempt.**

Historically, $COIN has only needed to touch its trendline once** in order to launch** (and itâ€™s done so three times since the start of 2023!).

### **3/ Ethereum ($ETH)**

View image: (https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXezfxuNFpEuL-EE_5w5V_87fy0qsbn3Q8_iYGbzoiW_6yweA5hgZOxGWGsaKMhI4Pvmfr9dLKjmgQjGJdEjsJQjh0-RYa-y7nC9WjAi1DrU6EgkAwmuT4vPJ7fr6Ek4zL7veXiUD6Lri7RHL8JfUzYAVbU-?key=c1Sm70ZlVj6dx1YBQu3Ehg)
Follow image link: (https://www.tradingview.com/)
Caption: Source: TradingView

Like Coinbase before it, Ethereum has a habit of bouncing off its trend and not looking back â€“ though it may be about to **break that habit** with a second touch of the trendline following Augustâ€™s crash.

Holding this trendline would be **as bullish as it is crucial **to [$ETHâ€™s](https://milkroad.com/buy/eth?utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter) long term health.

**Ok, so what can we take from these charts?**

Letâ€™s rip the bandaid off, right away! ðŸ©¹ 

If we start to see these assets break their trendlines at the weekly close, that could be **a very bad sign.**

(As the saying goes: â€œThe trend is your friend, until the end when it bends.â€)

But right now, weâ€™re **not seeing a whole lot of reasons** for these trends to bendâ€¦Â 

1. Retail spending is **up**Â 

2. Inflation is coming **down**

3. Rate cuts are **on their way** (which should help to increase the amount of money flowing into stocks, and risk assets like crypto).

Plus: when you look at [Bitcoin](https://milkroad.com/buy/btc?utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter) â€“ which tends to set the pace for the overall crypto market â€“ itâ€™s still in good health, **sitting **_**way**_** above its long term trendline.Â **

View image: (https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXdoqqJ9K2weVslsRb--w7aDQLiRV0ILx5NKnfybGYRcoMgqUm_Q3wD_MEIz0w_4zBZ5b7AWF6TvDRvh8EEbdEwAd7GrEDBUNh9jyaoKTNkBjipcisICbdftP-GbaZJ2DowGwfuOwXwqSznPwDLuInbv7fW2?key=c1Sm70ZlVj6dx1YBQu3Ehg)
Follow image link: (https://www.tradingview.com/)
Caption: Source: TradingView

Now â€“ nothing is set in stone. The market gods could well **make fools of us yetâ€¦ **ðŸ¤¡

But with the current macro backdrop, these assets are looking â€˜cheaperâ€™ than they are â€˜overpricedâ€™ in our eyes.

If we weren't already all-in, **we would be buying.**

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/0f3c76a5-695f-4014-bab9-7b4003a068d8/Intro_-_Add_a_subheading__1_.png?t=[PHONE_REDACTED])

# **[DONâ€™T SETTLE FOR A JANKY BROWSER WALLET!](https://out.milkroad.com/Enkrypt0904Main)**

Created by MyEtherWallet (the original Ethereum wallet), Enkrypt goes where you want to go onchain: **_absolutely anywhere_****.Â **

Built to be **truly multichain**, [Enkrypt](https://out.milkroad.com/Enkrypt0904Main) has 50+ natively integrated chains with more added weekly and is NOT exclusive to EVM.

Wanna be a Polkadot KOL? **We got all of Polkadot too. **

Kadena, Rootstock, Arthera, L2s and more.

Swap, buy, sell: everything you expect from a **self custody wallet**. ðŸ”‘

Donâ€™t settle when it comes to your crypto.Â 

[Download Enkrypt now!](https://out.milkroad.com/Enkrypt0904Main)




----------View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/0563732e-fc0d-4697-9d4f-fd4576545eed/image.png) [breaker]
Caption: 

# **COTD: THE SLOPE OF ENLIGHTENMENT **ðŸ§˜

This is the â€˜Slope of Enlightenmentâ€™ chart, which is a crypto-fied version of a chart used to explain the **Dunning Kruger Effect** ðŸ‘‡

View image: (https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXd-KB0e1kS84h2zmeR2nogkVYu_SL0ZVax4bhGhCCSHCKMQixGtuIWJXRiV6g06LHPWX-Otz_tK4EToj09wDMsFH078qZWTU4XZBa406C5O5evGqaNb5zPr6aRU51Dq8-VRYfTHEcjjUAoDs4eLnj6qlDw?key=c1Sm70ZlVj6dx1YBQu3Ehg)
Follow image link: (https://x.com/RyanWatkins_/status/182047854[PHONE_REDACTED]/)
Caption: Source: [Ryan Watkins](https://x.com/RyanWatkins_/status/182047854[PHONE_REDACTED]/) *We moved memecoins closer to the Trough of Disillusionment

The basic gist of both is that, when learning/building something new, most people/projects** tend to follow this pattern:**

1. You have an idea **(youâ€™re optimistic)**

2. You start building with no experience and high confidence **(youâ€™re cocky)**

3. You learn how little you know, and how hard it is to reach your goals **(you get schooled)**

4. Humbled, you start to rebuild your confidence through real experience **(you get to work)**

5. After years of learning / failing / building, your core vision is realized **(youâ€™re done!)**

Now, weâ€™re showing you this chart for two reasonsâ€¦

**First** â€“_ it shows just how early we all are to crypto.Â _â°

Bitcoin is the only project to have well and truly realized/completed its core vision â€“ **thatâ€™s super exciting **from an investment standpoint!

**Second **â€“ If thereâ€™s a sector/project that has **proven itself** to:Â 

* Be a good idea

* Not be total vaporware

* Have solid fundamentals (enough to endure)

Catching them in Step 3 (the â€˜Trough of Disillusionmentâ€™) can be like finding a **Gucci bag in a bargain bin! **ðŸ‘œ

All winning sectors/projects have had to trudge through the Trough of Disillusionment, in order to reach the Slope of Enlightenment, and **begin growing again.**

Some wonâ€™t make it out â€“ many will die in the Trough of Disillusionmentâ€¦

But if you can identify enduring sectors/projects (that are well poised to make the leap) while theyâ€™re at their lowest, most hype-deflated states â€“ thatâ€™s where the opportunity lies!Â 

(Use it to your advantage! ðŸ«¡)

subject: RVPTA: 2025â€“2026 Chair Opportunities
body:
Hi Roberge Families,

I hope you're having a wonderful summer so far! For those new to Roberge,
Iâ€™m Melissa Simon, Vice President of the RVPTA for Roberge. Youâ€™ll be
hearing from me throughout the year with updates on PTA programs and
events, volunteer opportunities, meeting reminders, and more.

Weâ€™re currently looking to fill several chair positions at Roberge for the
upcoming 2025â€“2026 school year. Our programs and fundraisers simply
wouldnâ€™t be possible without the support of our incredible parent
volunteers. If youâ€™re interested or would like more information, just reply
to this emailâ€”I'd love to hear from you!

*ART TO REMEMBER CHAIR (1 needed)*

   - Serving as the Art to Remember chair is a meaningful way to contribute
   to our school community. This role allows you to support both the arts and
   school fundraising efforts by helping families preserve their children's
   artwork in the form of cherished keepsakes. Itâ€™s a rewarding experience
   that celebrates student creativity while making a lasting impact.

*DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION COMMITTEE CHAIR (1-2 needed)*

   - Becoming the Diversity & Inclusion Chair gives you a chance to foster
   a welcoming, respectful, and inclusive school environment for all students
   and families. Itâ€™s a meaningful leadership role where you can spark
   positive change and celebrate what makes our community unique.

*PHOTO DAY CHAIR (1 needed)*

   - The Photo Day Chair helps coordinate school picture day by working
   with the main office to coordinate class schedules, assisting
   photographers, and ensuring the day runs smoothly. Itâ€™s a one-day
   commitment with a big impactâ€”and plenty of smiles!

*SOCIAL COMMITTEE CHAIR (2 needed)*

   - The Social Committee Chair helps plan and organize fun events for our
   Roberge families throughout the yearâ€”think movie nights, bowling
   activities, and anything else you can dream up. Itâ€™s a great role for
   anyone who loves to celebrate and spread a little joy!

*ASSEMBLY CHAIR (1 needed)*

   - The Assembly Chair works with school staff, the Woodside chair and the
   PTA to coordinate engaging, age-appropriate assemblies for students
   throughout the year. Itâ€™s a behind-the-scenes role that brings big moments
   to life for the whole school.

*LUNCH CHAIRS *
*Monday -1 needed*
*Tuesday-2 needed*
*Wednesday-2 needed*
*Friday-1 needed*

   - The Lunch Chair coordinates and oversees parent volunteers each week,
   ensuring thereâ€™s enough coverage, cross-checks lunch deliveries against the
   master list, and helps distribute lunches to students.

Let me know if you have any questions! I look forward to hearing from you!

Melissa
RVPTA - VP of Roberge

-- 
Melissa Simon, Founder
The Home Refresh
https://homerefreshnj.com/ <http://www.HomeRefreshNJ.com>

subject: RE: Matthew Hanson v. Elizabeth Hanson
body:
Matt,  See my comments.


  1.  Cost of Living increases, which are typically done via probation THIS IS NOT STANDARD FOR A DIRECT PAY AND WAS NOT AGREED UPON
  2.  Additional out of pocket therapies; and   THERE IS NO AGREEMENT YOU OWE HER ARREARS FOR PREVIOUS THERAPIES
  3.  HELOC payments; and THERE IS NO AGREEMENT THAT YOU OWE HER ARREARS FOR HELOC
  4.  Chase credit card charges. THERE IS NO AGREEMENT THAT YOU OWE HER FOR CHARGES ON CHASE.



WHAT DID THE $7500 REPRESENT THAT YOU REIMBURSED HER FOR???  I WAS NEVER PRIVY TO THIS.


Joanna D. Brick, Esq.
Brick Law, L.L.C.
16-00 Route 208 South, Suite 302
Fairlawn, New Jersey 07410

Facsimile: [PHONE_REDACTED]

From: Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 6, 2025 3:01 PM
To: Joanna Brick <user_6b9fb6d0@example.com>; The Assistant <user_a2bb7436@example.com>
Subject: Re: Matthew Hanson v. Elizabeth Hanson


  1.  Is this standard, if so - fine.

  1.  sure. She communicates nothing to me. What part of the 2k child support goes to therapy? I think we agreed that therapy was separate from child support, but I want to make sure.

  1.  Idk I guess so. I'm a week away from having no income and I am reluctant. What is she saying? That she has paid the HELOC since I left and I owe her 50% of her past payments and that I have to split the HELOC 50/[ADDRESS_REDACTED] unless we pay it off?

  1.  I have no idea what she is talking about with this. I assume there are subscriptions that still hit her card or something.  I did pay off and I did think we were square. Again, she does not communicate and I don't know what is still hitting her card.

________________________________
From: Joanna Brick <user_6b9fb6d0@example.com<mailto:user_6b9fb6d0@example.com>>
Sent: Tuesday, May 6, 2025 2:27:27 PM
To: user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com> <user_8545e5c1@example.com<mailto:user_8545e5c1@example.com>>; The Assistant <user_a2bb7436@example.com<mailto:user_a2bb7436@example.com>>
Subject: Matthew Hanson v. Elizabeth Hanson


HI Matt,



I am in receipt of counsel's redline agreement. I have reviewed it in the context of Mark's mediation session of Feb. 2025.  It appears that your wife is seeking the following not agreed upon and incurred prior/subsequent to the mediation session:



  1.  Cost of Living increases, which are typically done via probation;
  2.  Additional out of pocket therapies; and
  3.  HELOC payments; and
  4.  Chase credit card charges.



I thought that you satisfied any and all out of pocket costs by providing the $7500 cash to her (which you prematurely released to her).  Please see my redline removals.   I will not address with counsel until I have heard back from you.



Kindly



Joanna D. Brick, Esq.

subject: YOU ARE INVITED: "Public Health vs. The Nanny State"
body:
Dear Ken:

News stories abound almost daily over the alleged need for
governments to proscribe various foods, beverages, cell phones, and
much more.  Yet, Americans are healthier and live longer than ever.
So, what is the real story here?

As a result, I am very pleased to invite you to attend the upcoming
Independent Policy Forum reception and seminar, "PUBLIC HEALTH vs.
THE NANNY STATE?"

http://www.independent.org/tii/forums/001026ipf.html

This program will feature syndicated columnist and Reason Magazine
senior editor, JACOB SULLUM, author of the book, FOR YOUR OWN GOOD,
and economist THOMAS DiLORENZO, co-author of the new book, FROM
PATHOLOGY TO POLITICS.

The program will be held Thursday evening, October 26th, from 6:30 to
8:30 p.m., at the Independent Institute's conference center in
Oakland, California.

For your review, I am adding below an invitation with further details
on the program.  Since seating is limited, please make your
reservations as soon as possible.  For further information, please
contact me or the Institute's Events Coordinator, Ms. [NAME_REDACTED], at [PHONE_REDACTED] X118.

We hope to see you on October 26.

Sincerely,

David J. Theroux
Founder and President
The Independent Institute
100 Swan Way
Oakland, CA 95621-1428
[PHONE_REDACTED] Phone
[PHONE_REDACTED] Fax
user_fe53dc68@example.org
http://www.independent.org

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

PUBLIC HEALTH vs. THE NANNY STATE? -- Next Independent Policy Forum (10/26/00)
http://www.independent.org/tii/forums/001026ipf.html

Barely a day goes by without some news of the latest public health
"threat." Serious health hazards, we are told, lurk around every
corner -- in water supplies, air, soil, beverages, fast food,
second-hand smoke, cellular phones, and food irradiation, just to
name a handful. And yet, Americans today live longer than ever! Are
markets and private decision-making providing the answers? Or are
these dangers real, immediate, and a legitimate mandate for
government control? Can we reduce or eliminate health risks without
government dictates? How does politics distort perceptions about
public health? Will Americans succumb to or rebel against the growing
Nanny State's neo-Puritanism and attack on individual choice and
responsibility? JACOB SULLUM and THOMAS DiLORENZO will discuss these
timely and important issues.

SPEAKERS:

      - Jacob Sullum (Syndicated Columnist and Senior Editor, Reason
magazine; Author, FOR YOUR OWN GOOD)

      - Thomas DiLorenzo (Professor of Economics, Loyola College of
Maryland; Co-author, FROM PATHOLOGY TO POLITICS: Public Health in
America)

WHEN:
       Thursday, October 26, 2000
       Reception and book signing: 6:30 p.m.
       Program: 7:00 - 8:30 p.m.

WHERE:
       The Independent Institute Conference Center
       100 Swan Way
       Oakland, CA 94621-1428
       For a map and directions, see
       http://www.independent.org/tii/tii_info/about.html#map

TICKETS:
       $30.00 per person: includes one copy of either Jacob Sullum's
book, FOR YOUR OWN GOOD, or Thomas DiLorenzo's book, FROM PATHOLOGY
TO POLITICS.
       OR, admission without a book is $10 per person ($7 for
Independent Institute Associate Members)


About FOR YOUR OWN GOOD:

"Sullum is meticulously logical, and his conclusions are implicit in
everything he argues. FOR YOUR OWN GOOD has made us think about
totalitarianism in this most unlikely context."
      - NEW YORK TIMES

"Intriguing and worthwhile, this book marshals an impressive array of
facts and arguments. Thoughtful and articulate."
      - NEW ENGLAND JOURNAL OF MEDICINE

About FROM PATHOLOGY TO POLITICS: Public Health in America:

"FROM PATHOLOGY TO POLITICS argues that public health has become a
bureaucracy that feels the need to perpetuate itself by expanding
into new areas that are more often than not, just plain 'politically
correct.'"
      - WALL STREET JOURNAL

For more information about this event, see
http://www.independent.org/tii/forums/001026ipf.html

body:
January 03, 2025

***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
Collection: Nvidia ( https://www.theinformation.com/?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 )
***************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

Insights into Nvidiaâ€™s AI innovations and competitive landscape

The Information's [ADDRESS_REDACTED] Promising Startups 2024 ( https://www.theinformation.com/subscribe?offer=newyear2025-749%2Cnewyear2025-299%2Cnewyear2025-225&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 )

Key highlights:

*
Nvidia customers are worried about snags involving server racks ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/nvidia-customers-worry-about-snag-with-new-ai-chip-servers?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 ) for its highly anticipated Blackwell chips.
*
We show how each major AI developer is moving into the territory of its rivals ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/openai-nvidia-and-their-rivals-expand-ai-turf-wars?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 ) or customers and what they could do next to fill obvious gaps.
*
Nvidia says it could build a cloud business to rival AWS ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/nvidia-says-it-could-build-a-cloud-business-rivaling-aws-is-that-possible?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 ) and other software firms, generating $150 billion in revenue. Is that possible?

--------
Business
--------

Nvidia Customers Worry About Snag With New AI Chip Servers ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/nvidia-customers-worry-about-snag-with-new-ai-chip-servers?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 )

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By Qianer Liu and Anissa Gardizy

How Apple Developed an Nvidia Allergy ( https://www.theinformation.com/articles/how-apple-developed-an-nvidia-allergy?offer=monthly-digest-2025-299&cio_link_id=CIO--LINKID&utm_campaign=Leads%3A+Nvidia+Collec&utm_content=6576&utm_medium=email&utm_source=cio&utm_term=4542 )

subject: Orlando
body:
To all,

I spoke with Jan Aspuru (OUC) this morning.  He indicated the max volume they would take summer would be 60,000 mmbtu/day ten year term.  He went on to say that a winter drop to 50,000 mmbtu/day would help put our proposal in line with what they are currently looking at.  We should assume winter to be November - March.  

Items to consider:

Scott - Is their a price drop to entice them into 60,000 baseload to gain access to the winter economics on the 10,000 drop.  i.e.  Do we offer Hub plus .53 for sixty baseload?  Something to consider and your call.  When LNG comes up, notice I said when, we can sculpt.

FM - standard natural gas industry language?  If LNG becomes cover, doesn't allow for any shipping delays, etc.
LD strategy - do we put caps on penalties or an out clause if nondelivery occurs for a certain number of days, presumably a number of months consecutively.

Timeline - We need to get a proposal to them by mid-month.  It appears a short negotiation period to close ends can be had after the previously mentioned July 1 deadline.  Short means about a month.

During our initial discussion, OUC suggested preferred pricing would be Gas Daily Zn 2 plus $.55.  We suggested with our risk management abilities we would consider any pricing they preferred and further suggested Index with the right to convert to Gas Daily or others.  Does the desk have a preference? - Gas Daily exposure seems better for us - but conversion could still be had even under a Gas Daily contract - need your thoughts.  In this regard, I have set a meeting with credit, Phil I'd like you to attend, at 9am tomorrow to begin the process.

Give these items some thought and I will schedule a meeting for Wednesday, June 6th at 4pm in 3259 to discuss.

Phil and I will continue to work toward that meeting.

Thanks for your assistance as we move forward to this agreement.

Regards,

Jared

subject: Emergency : Sessions for Charlie
body:
Hey Sharon and dr Kelsey

We are in a bit of a crisis right now as Charlie has been trying to stick
loose change into electrical sockets. She mentioned something like seeing a
YouTube video, but we are really concerned that she is making attempts at
suicide. She had a full on panic attack yesterday.

Sharon, I know you are in ny and we donâ€™t know what to do.

Susan, I know things have been difficult with Charlie and zoom but we have
some experience working together here so Iâ€™m reaching out to you as well.

-Matt
