subject: "Boring" UK landmarks | Notre-Dame spire video | Nike Olympic shoes
body:
Latest architecture and design news from Dezeen.         View online https://newsletter.dezeen.com/t/r-e-tiuytta-hkiiidjtii-td/

RAD+ar encloses tropical Frame Garden with mirrored panels in Indonesia [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/frame-garden-radar-jakarta-indonesia/]   Large  mirrors [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/mirrored-buildings/] frame the tree-planted interiors of this  cafe [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/cafes/] and seating area beside a park in  Jakarta [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/jakarta/], Indonesia, completed by local studio Research Artistic Design + architecture.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/frame-garden-radar-jakarta-indonesia/]

Thomas Heatherwick's Humanise campaign creates "boring alter-egos" of UK landmarks [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/boring-uk-landmarks-boring-thomas-heatherwick-humanise-campaign/]   Creative agency Uncommon Creative Studio has made "boring" versions of UK landmarks including Buckingham Palace and Edinburgh Castle for  Thomas Heatherwick [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/thomas-heatherwick/]'s Humanise campaign.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/boring-uk-landmarks-boring-thomas-heatherwick-humanise-campaign/]

Dezeen video captures reconstructed spire at Notre-Dame [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/dezeen-video-notre-dame-reconstruction/]   This  Dezeen video [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/dezeen-videos/] shows the restoration progress of  Notre-Dame cathedral [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/notre-dame/] in  Paris [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/paris/], including its reconstructed spire that is crowned by a golden rooster.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/dezeen-video-notre-dame-reconstruction/]

Leo Maher references "queer legends" with Something Sticky lighting sculptures [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/something-sticky-lights-leo-maher-queer-legends/]   British artist-designer Leo Maher has created sculptural lights that tell stories about  homosexuality [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/lgbtq/], set to feature in the  Alcova [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/alcova/] exhibition during  Milan design week [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/milan-design-week/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/something-sticky-lights-leo-maher-queer-legends/]

OblÃ² pendant light by Paola Navone for Lodes [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/oblo-pendant-light-paola-navone-lodes-dezeen-showroom/]    Dezeen Showroom: [http://www.dezeen.com/showroom] Italian architect  Paola Navone [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/paola-navone/] collaborated with Venetian brand  Lodes [https://www.dezeen.com/showroom/lodes/] to create OblÃ², a  pendant light [https://dezeen.com/tag/pendant-lights/] with a chromatic palette designed to recall "the sensations of the sea".

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/oblo-pendant-light-paola-navone-lodes-dezeen-showroom/]

Study finds botanical gardens offer "greater cooling effect" in cities compared to parks [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/gcare-global-centre-for-clean-air-research-botanical-gardens-city-cooling/]   The Global Centre for Clean Air Research has published research that found botanical  gardens [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/parks-and-gardens/] are one of the best ways to cool  cities [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/cities/] and mitigate the effects of heatwaves.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/gcare-global-centre-for-clean-air-research-botanical-gardens-city-cooling/]

Saint Laurent rereleases handpainted Gio Ponti plates designed for Villa Planchart [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/saint-laurent-rereleases-gio-ponti-plates-villa-planchart/]   French fashion house  Saint Laurent [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/saint-laurent/] will unveil the Villa Planchart Segnaposto collection of [ADDRESS_REDACTED]  Gio Ponti [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/gio-ponti/] in 1957 at  Milan design week [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/milan-design-week/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/saint-laurent-rereleases-gio-ponti-plates-villa-planchart/]

Poetica furniture system by Scavolini [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/poetica-furniture-system-scavolini-dezeen-showroom/]    Dezeen Showroom: [http://www.dezeen.com/showroom] Italian design brand  Scavolini [https://www.dezeen.com/showroom/scavolini/] has released a  modular [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/modular-design/] furnishing system that allows users to customise  kitchens [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/kitchens/] and  living rooms [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/living-rooms/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/12/poetica-furniture-system-scavolini-dezeen-showroom/]

Workshop Architecture Inc creates "raw and unvarnished" prefabricated home in Ontario [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/workshop-architecture-inc-raw-unvarnished-prefabricated-home-ontario/]   Toronto studio Workshop Architecture Inc has created a  prefabricated [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/prefabricated-buildings/] home in  Ontario [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/ontario/] with an exposed structure and blue-painted element on the  interior [https://www.dezeen.com/interiors/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/workshop-architecture-inc-raw-unvarnished-prefabricated-home-ontario/]

Dezeen Debate features "a delicious slice of design cake" [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/dezeen-debate-brick-home-fletcher-crane-architects/]   The  latest edition of our Dezeen Debate newsletter [https://newsletter.dezeen.com/t/r-311B1BEC7D1E3B0E2540EF23F30FEDED] features  Fletcher Crane Architects' pale brick home overlooking Richmond Park in London [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/05/fletcher-crane-architects-kingston-villa-london/?utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Dezeen%20Debate%20859&utm_content=Dezeen%20Debate%20859+Preview+CID_fcef242850896f297f409bc111441103&utm_source=Dezeen%20Mail&utm_term=A%20mixture%20of%20traditional%20forms%20and%20clean%20modern%20lines].  Subscribe to Dezeen Debate [https://www.dezeen.com/newsletters] now.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/dezeen-debate-brick-home-fletcher-crane-architects/]

Page Southerland Page integrates "past and future" at Texas Capitol Complex [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/texas-capitol-complex-green-mall-glass-offices-page/]   US studio Page Southerland Page has worked to "cultivate a stronger sense of community" with the  urban design [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/urban-design/] surrounding the Texas State Capitol that integrates historical landmarks in  Austin [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/austin/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/texas-capitol-complex-green-mall-glass-offices-page/]

New York Institute of Technology spotlights seven fabrication and robotics projects [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/new-york-institute-of-technology-fabrication-robotics-projects-dezeen-schoolshows/]    Dezeen School Shows: [https://www.dezeen.com/schoolshows/] a  3D printed [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/3d-printing/] panel made from  wood [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/wood/] and  clay [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/clay/] that is filled in with  hempcrete [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/hempcrete/] is included in this school show by the  New York Institute of Technology [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/new-york-institute-of-technology/].

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/new-york-institute-of-technology-fabrication-robotics-projects-dezeen-schoolshows/]

Nike unveils "new and better" athlete shoes ahead of Paris Olympics [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/nike-blueprint-pack-athlete-shoes-paris-olympics/]   Sportswear brand  Nike [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/nike/] has unveiled its new collection of elite  footwear [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/shoes/] ahead of the  Paris 2024 Olympic Games [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/paris-2024-olympic-games/] this summer, claiming that  AI [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/ai/] is sparking a "super cycle" of innovation.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/nike-blueprint-pack-athlete-shoes-paris-olympics/]

Stilo furniture system by Spalvieri & Del Ciotto for Scavolini [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/stilo-furniture-system-spalvieri-del-ciotto-scavolini-dezeen-showroom/]    Dezeen Showroom: [http://www.dezeen.com/showroom] industrial design studio Spalvieri & Del Ciotto has designed the Stilo  furniture [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/furniture/] system for Italian brand  Scavolini [https://www.dezeen.com/showroom/scavolini/] that includes a range of composition possibilities.

Read more â€º [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/stilo-furniture-system-spalvieri-del-ciotto-scavolini-dezeen-showroom/]

BetteAnti-Slip Sense treatment by Bette [https://www.dezeen.com/2024/04/11/betteanti-slip-treatment-bette-dezeen-showroom/]    Dezeen Showroom: [http://www.dezeen.com/showroom] German bathroom brand  Bette [https://www.dezeen.com/showroom/bette/] has created two anti-slip surfaces, one that can be applied to glossy white  baths [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/bath-design/] and  shower [https://www.dezeen.com/tag/showers/] trays and one for use with coloured and matt-textured fixtures.

 -----Original Message-----

To:	Miller, Paul; Tuttle, Bruce
Subject:	FW: Fw: FW: Breaking News



 -----Original Message-----
From: 	"Gesell, Tom A" <user_b27dd6c3@example.com>@ENRON  
Sent:	Friday, November 02, 2001 1:37 PM
To:	Dutler, Jane M; Dutler, Jane M; Meyer, Mitch; Scott McCoig (E-mail); Wally Piepho (E-mail); Semin, Frank
Subject:	FW: Fw: FW: Breaking News


> 
> 
> >> University of Kansas Football Practice Delayed 
> >> Kansas City Star 
> >> October 29, 2001 
> >> 
> >> The University of Kansas Jayhawks' afternoon football practice was 
> >> delayed 
> >> on Monday for nearly two hours at Memorial Stadium. One of the 
> >> players, 
> >> while on his way to the field happened to look down and notice a 
> >> suspicious looking, unknown white powdery substance on the practice 
> >> field. Head coach Terry Allen immediately suspended practice while 
> >> the Kansas Bureau of Investigation & FBI were called in to 
> >> investigate. After a complete field analysis, the FBI determined that 
> >> the white substance unknown to the players was the goal line. 
> >> Practice was resumed when FBI Special Agents decided that the team 
> >> was not likely to encounter the substance again. 
>

>
>
>
> I am still furious - she is negligent.
>
>
>
> I tried to slow down and do this right for a long time, taking every
> opportunity to level with Liz, both with and without legal counsel, in
> therapy and out. I set up therapy for the children too. I tried to
> negotiate fair terms of a custody arrangement in a civilized manner because
> I believe that not doing so is detrimental to the emotional and mental
> health, and well-being of our children.
>
>
>
> We both presumably want our children to grow up in a healthy, stable
> environment. Iâ€™m afraid I no longer see it possible to benevolently
> negotiate a fair and balanced divorce/custody agreement that poses the
> least amount of net-harm to all parties involved, namely our children.
>
>
>
> I need to understand what facts I need to prove to pursue a path of full

subject: Update from Airtable
body: Hi Matt, Thank you so much for taking the time to apply for the Product Manager, AI role. We know a lot of thought and consideration went into your application, and we genuinely appreciate your interest in joining the team here at Airtable. Unfortunately, we have made the decision to move forward with other candidates whose experience more closely aligns with our team's needs. Thanks again for your interest in Airtable! We wish you the best of luck in your current search. Regards, The Recruiting Team at Airtable

According to new survey data from Electric Vehicle Intelligence Report, some 70% of Americans said in August that autonomous vehicles should employ both cameras and lidar, while 71% said the government should require companies to use both. Just 3% of respondents chose â€œautonomous vehicles should only use camerasâ€ as the answer closest to their view. Tesla CEO Elon Musk would appear to be among them. This mass exit was first triggered by what economists call â€œ excess retirements â€ from both lower-income workers pushed out by job losses and wealthier baby boomers riding the 2020-21 asset boom. Check out this interactive chart that puts Nvidiaâ€™s trading volume into perspective.   What else we're Snackin' Like Hims & Hers CEO Andrew Dudum , Opendoor â€™s new interim leader, Shrisha Radhakrishna, is actively engaging with its retail investors, the â€œ $OPEN Army â€ Meta Superintelligence Labs is off to a rocky start Spirit Airlines is reportedly headed for its second bankruptcy in a year â€œK

>
> Welcome to Fubo, we're looking forward to your start on
>
> Monday, 7/21/2025!
>

> will go over a brief session via Zoom. HR will continue with the onboarding
> portion where you'll get to learn more about the team and culture!
> Additionally, we'll go over benefits and payroll.
>
>
> You can find the *New Hire Orientation *Zoom meeting link on your
> calendar upon logging in to your Fubo Gmail account.
>
>
> Okta is our single sign-on solution that you will need to login to access
> Google Workspace and other business applications. Please use this link
> fubotv.okta.com

>

>
> *LOGIN INFO*

>
> *Email: *user_80239b00@example.com
>

>

> office, Tuesday, July
> <https://www.google.com/maps/search/1290+Ave+of+Americas,+9th+Floor+%0D%0A+New+York,+NY+10104?entry=gmail&source=g>
> 22. Dan Sormaz, copied here, will plan on meeting you at reception at 10
> AM on Tuesday, 7/22.
>
>  We are located at -
> *1290 Ave of Americas, 9th Floor
> <https://www.google.com/maps/search/1290+Ave+of+Americas,+9th+Floor+%0D%0A+New+York,+NY+10104?entry=gmail&source=g>*

>

subject: Follow up
body:
HI Matt,



In preparation for this week, what were your thoughts about the buyout of
the home with your wifeâ€™s potion regarding $100,000 to your parents and the
HELOC?  Are you willing to walk away from her half of the funds from your
parents and half of the HELOC?



Also, what were your thoughts on her demand for alimony?  Last we spoke,
you were going to pay the alimony â€œupfrontâ€.  Keep in mind that all the of
the stock options you are currently exercising were acquired during the
marriage and your wife has a claim for one half of these (to be further
addressed).



Let me know your thoughts.



Joanna D. Brick, Esq.

Brick Law, L.L.C.

16-00 Route 208 South, Suite 302

Fairlawn, New Jersey 07410

Telephone: [PHONE_REDACTED]

Facsimile: [PHONE_REDACTED]

E-mail: user_6b9fb6d0@example.com

Website: www.joannabricklaw.com

enclosures thereto is being transmitted from a Law Firm and shall be

subject: Re: Sup homie!
body:
Also let's meet at [ADDRESS_REDACTED] to jump on a call 2-3 at home and it'll take me a bit to get into the city.

Cool?

> On May 10, 2017, at 11:12, Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
> 
> don't really know jack about sf but that works.
>> On Wed, May 10, 2017 at 10:48 AM Tony Barbieri <user_883cffd4@example.com> wrote:
>> Sounds good! Meet in SF? Mission area maybe?
>> 
>>> On Wed, May 10, 2017 at 7:46 AM, Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>> Sweet. Let's do Friday afternoon? My interviews get out at about 2 and my flights not until about 1145.
>>> 
>>> I might see if I could dick around the campus for a bit and maybe meet up around 3 or 4?
>>> 
>>> Lmk!
>>> 
>>> -Matt
>>> 
>>>> On Tue, May 9, 2017 at 8:53 PM Tony Barbieri <user_883cffd4@example.com> wrote:
>>>> Hey so I have something Thursday 5:30-7:30 in downtown SF. Free otherwise!
>>>> 
>>>> --
>>>> Tony
>>>> 
>>>>> On May 8, 2017, at 10:12, Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>>>> 
>>>>> Hey Tony,
>>>>> 
>>>>> Sorry to hear about the Story Studio, if you'd like me to introduce you to anyone at the FramestoreVR Studio lmk.
>>>>> 
>>>>> In the meantime, I'll be flying out for an interview w FB on Thursday and leaving Friday evening.
>>>>> 
>>>>> Idk how much time I'll have to get to SF, but maybe we can grab some dinner?
>>>>> 
>>>>> -Matt
>>>>>> On Wed, Apr 26, 2017 at 3:28 PM Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>> Niccccce. Will let you know more when I find out deets.
>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> On Wed, Apr 26, 2017 at 2:04 PM Tony Barbieri <user_883cffd4@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>>> Awesome!!! Yeah, we're here then lets meet up!!
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> On Wed, Apr 26, 2017 at 11:01 AM, Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>> Hey nerd! Looks like ill be coming out there for an interview with FB. I think itll prob be on the 11th/12th of May. Are yall gonna be in town?
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>> -Matt
>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> On Mon, Apr 17, 2017 at 10:25 AM Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>> Yea, we'll see what happens. It was just a prelim call (which is nice, always wanted to be recruited), but hopefully it leads to something. 
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> What are you doing over at the OSS? Is your commute different from Erins? How do the shuttles work?
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> Things are ok here at Framestore, Been pitching stuff for months and really just want to make shit. I had high expectations for this gig and unfortunately its just not living up to what I had hoped for (no culture, no process, working in a vacuum). I think FB could be a good fit, we shall see. 
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>> -Matt
>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> On Fri, Apr 14, 2017 at 4:58 PM Tony Barbieri <user_883cffd4@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>> Yo!
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Nice man, that's awesome! I'm over at Story Studio which has been really cool. The move was great. A little stressful initially (what move isn't) but in the end went smooth. Really like it out here. Erin and I are living in Oakland. Her commute can be long but the Facebook shuttles are pretty nice and we like living over in that area.
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Hit me up with any other questions you have!!
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> Things going well on your end?
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>> On Fri, Apr 14, 2017 at 7:20 AM, Matt Hanson <user_8a00487b@example.com> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>>> How are thing's going?
>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>> I've been working as a CD at the Framestore VR Lab in NYC, but recently got contacted by a creative recruiter at Facebook to potentially work with a new R&D group (coincidentally where Andreas Berner is at)
>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>> What are you up to? Are you at the Story Studio? How was the move to the west coast? So many questions...
>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>> Hope all is well, prob going to reach out to Erin soon to ask some q's about FB and the like, but im certainly intrigued.
>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>> -Matt
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>> -- 
>>>>>>>>>> Tony
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>> -- 
>>>>>>> Tony
>> 
>> 
>> 
>> -- 
>> Tony

subject: Re: PG&E
body:
Believe it or not, we are almost done but PG&E's lawyer has been so busy that 
we were unable to schedule a call last week.  I will send her some suggested 
comments (tonight) and we are trying to speak this week.  There aren't any 
problems.  Sara


   
	
	
	From:  Jennifer Fraser                           04/25/2000 01:30 PM
	

To: Sara Shackleton/HOU/ECT@ECT
cc: Craig Breslau/HOU/ECT@ECT 
Subject: PG&E

Sara:
What is the status?
Thanks
Jen

subject: Re: Pictures & report
body:
Yes, why don't you send the insurance information to us.  We have
received three quotes from the local man representing the company who is
handling my new 401K plan.  We could compareall of them and then talk to
you about it.  How does that sound?  How much information is there?
Would it be too much to fax?  If not, you could fax it to my work number
on Friday when I am there.  I don't have the fax number here at home, but
I can call there tomorrow (Thursday,) get it and get back to you.

We got a little more snow yesterday, but nothing compared to what Phyllis
and Tim both must have gotten!  I guess they are setting records for
North Carolina.  It surely is cold here, though.  I had to go downtown
today and the wind blowing up and down the streets between the buildings
was really bitter.  Three international flights bound for JFK had to land
here and stay all night.  Delta nearly filled a 500 room hotel!  There go
our ticket prices up again!

Love, Mother

On Mon, 24 Jan 2000 16:48:20 -0600 "Mark Taylor" <user_b0be8e53@example.com>
writes:
>
>
>Glad you liked them.  Yes, cats do seem to like to explore all sorts
>of spaces -
>grocery bags are always a good bet.  I remember Dusty, the cat we had
>in
>Bethesda, used to like to sleep at the foot of my bed - under the
>covers.  Go
>figure.  I'd be happy to send you acopy of the photo of me.
>
>And yes again, the online platform mentioned in the analyst's report
>is the
>system I've spent so much time on over the last nine months or so.
>It's kind of
>exciting to see a project in print like that but now it means we have
>to really
>make it work!
>
>I received the package from MetLife on the Long-Term Care insurance.
>I had a
>couple of questions which I called the company about (premiums,
>pre-tax vs.
>after tax, etc.) and would be happy to go over it with you.  Do you
>want me to
>send the stuff to you or should we just chart about it frst?
>
>Love, Mark

Vince

05:38 PM ---------------------------


<user_8fa34af9@example.edu> on 09/22/2000 07:14:37 PM
To: <user_9a646ddc@example.com>
cc:  
Subject: Hi:



Hi Vince:
This Zeigham Khokher at the University of Texas at  Austin, Finance 
Department.
?
I need some publicly available data that  unfortunately is not available 
here.? It is basically the historical prices  for price of oil, gas and gold 
futures contracts and options.
?
Again the data is strictly public info and not  proprietary at all.? Let me 
know if there is a central data person at Enron  who would be able to help.? 
All help will be of course gratefully  acknowledged.
?
Hope all is well, I hear you will be giving a talk  at UT this fall?and look 
forward to seeing you then.
?
Regards
Zeigham
?
?

subject: Advisory council meeting
body:
Let me review where we stand for the April 10-11 meeting.
1.  I have spoken with Gavyn and asked him to add to his usual review
comments on the significance of recent developments for Enron.
2.  I have asked Bill Kristol to do the same.
3.  I have asked Paul Portney to review "the lay of the land" in the
environmental policy area.
4.  Since we couldn't locate a speaker to address the question of how Enron,
now larger and more corporate than in the past, can continue to attract the
best, the brightest (and the oddest?), I have asked Pankaj to give a brief
talk about what the literature generated by his colleagues has to tell us on
this subject.
5.  I couldn't get anyone on the "monopoly-too-big-and-powerful" question,
although I am still trying.
I assume you folks will brief us on California and the national energy supply
picture. Have we heard from the author of "When Genius Fails"?

subject: Re: Entex Transport Reimbursement
body:
Yes, but I would say that the $200,000/mo during the winter is related to an 
HPL discount on Transport given to the marketing desk in order to make the 
deal more economical.




   
	Enron North America Corp.
	
	From:  Heidi Withers                           01/20/2000 10:28 AM
	

To: Eric Bass/HOU/ECT@ECT
cc:  
Subject: Re: Entex Transport Reimbursement

Bass, is this accurate?

Ed asked me to find revenue from Entex for transportation expense to 
Lufkin/Diboll for the residential part of the contract (Transaction 10).  
After checking into it, we have all found the following things:

1. Howard allocates the Lufkin/Diboll meters (7107/8/9) based on actuals.
2. Howard receives allocations from Entex for the industrial volumes, and 
then backs into the Transaction 10 (residential) volumes for Lufkin/Diboll.
3. Howard allocates the residential piece for Lufkin/Diboll to Transaction 10.
4. Kyle bills Entex for the residential volume, and applies the cash to the 
sales invoice.
5. Cassandra cuts an invoice to Co. 16 to get reimbursed for the transport 
expense going up to Lufkin/Diboll for the residential volume.
6. Eric tells Mick how much expense Tom is including in his P&L for this 
transportation, and Mick includes it in Ed's P&L as revenue from the 
Marketing   Desk.
7. Phillip does manual G/L entries to show an expense to Tom and a revenue to 
Ed for the same amount .
8. This revenue shows up en masse with all of the other revenue from the 
marketing desk in Ed's P&L.

The total revenue for Ed for this portion is about $6,000 per month.  Eric 
says, too, that Ed shows revenue during the winter months for transport for 
Entex of about $200,000 per month from the marketing desk.  This comes from 
money reserved to manage the Entex deal.

subject: To: All Domestic Employees who Participate in the Enron Corp.
body:
Mark your calendar-- 
	the Enron Corp. Savings Plan is moving to a new administrator!

In preparation, here are a few things you need to remember.

For All Savings Plan participants, Friday, October 19 at 3:00pm CST will be the last day to:
?	Request a loan or a loan payoff so that funds can be allocated or distributed in time.
?	Request a withdrawal (In-service or Hardship).

For SDA Participants, Friday, October 19 at 3:00pm CST will be your last day to:
?	Make trades in your Schwab SDA brokerage account so that we can move your holdings in-kind. 
?	Re-invest any Schwab mutual funds into your choice of funds  - the default will be your money market fund.

Other transactions, such as Contribution Rate Changes and Investment Fund Transfers, will continue until 3:00pm CST on October 26.  

EnronBenefits... keeping pace with your lifestyle.

subject: Rates Changes
body:
Keep in mind that when you do amendments to move primary points around, the rate must be changed in CBS for the corresponding new paths.  Otherwise, CBS reflects  max rates.

It would also be helpful when a new contract is executed that the rate be put in CBS; otherwise, again CBS reflects max rates.

It is important to get these rates in CBS as the forecasting model pulls all rate information from CBS.  If CBS reflects max rates the revenues will be grossly over estimated.

Thanks for your help!  


Jan

subject: Re: Survey Documentation
body:
Hi, Matt & Liz:

Itâ€™s been my pleasure to assist.
Thank you both very much for
the opportunity! Weâ€™re going to
provide your family with a smooth
relocation to New Jersey.

1. I canâ€™t guarantee anything
this time of year (as busy as we are),
but let me see what/if I can do with
the costs.
2. As for the loading dates. Weâ€™d need for
you (or a representative) to be present for
the packing and loading mornings. So, Iâ€™d
suggest we plan for the 19th to get it loaded
(and 18th for packing). Does this work for you
both?

Thank you both again for entrusting myself
and Town & Country to be a part of your big
relocation! I will be your direct point of contact
throughout your arrival in New Jersey.
Call, text or email if your to need anything at
all along the way. Let me know if those dates
work for loading and I will see what I can do
on the costs.

V/R,
[photo-logo]
Doug Smith
Relocation Specialist Town & Country Movers

m: [PHONE_REDACTED]
a: [ADDRESS_REDACTED]., Gaithersburg, MD
e: user_0a12a5bf@example.com<mailto:user_0a12a5bf@example.com>
 https://linktr.ee/townandcountrymovers


YOUR DIRECT REFERRALS ARE VERY MUCH APPRECIATED!!!

Dougâ€™s ability to smoothly coordinate with so many different people in such a rapidly changing situation was truly the key ingredient to the ultimate success of the move and to it being a positive experience for all involved.

On Jun 2, 2022, at 7:04 PM, Matthew Hanson <user_8545e5c1@example.com> wrote:

ï»¿
Hey Doug

Thanks for all your work to get this estimate together. Weâ€™d love to hire you for the move and had a couple of questions;

1-Costs: Is there any way we can get our costs down to 25k?

2-Dates: We will be leaving the house to catch a flight at about 6am on July 20th. There are a couple of ways we can slice this, depending on whether or not we have to be physically present for the loading day. If we do not have to be there, it would be great to set the 20th as our loading day and back fill the remaining packing dates. Alternatively, if we do need to be present, letâ€™s set the 19th as our loading day and back fill the schedule from there.

Thanks again, we look forward to working together in the coming weeks!

-Matt + Liz

subject: Referred to You By the Greens about Possibly Growing Grapes on My
body:
Greetings Sally:
My name is Jeff Dasovich.  The Greens have been helping me develop 40 acres
of land that I bought just north of Anchor Bay (a couple of miles up the
hill from Highway One, about 1200 ft or so up) and they suggested that I
contact you.

The property is right in the heart of the Banana Belt and my property faces
south, is protected, and a such is very hot and sunny from late spring
through later summer/early fall.  The property has an abundance of water on
it.  Of course, the possibility of evening fog raises some tricky issues,
and I haven't done soil tests.  In short, while I think there are some
challenges, I'm convinced that there is at least the strong possibility
that I could grow grapes--around 10 acres or so.

I'm sure that you're extremely busy, but I'd be very interested in talking

Best,
Jeff

> 
> https://www.ourfamilywizard.com/practitioners

> https://www.ourfamilywizard.com/knowledge-center/tips-tricks/parents-website/third-party-versus-practitioner
> 
> From what I understand, we can invite you as a third-party user or a practitioner. Both options are free. As a third-party, you would only see messages you are cc'd on. As a practitioner, you would see all messages at all times, plus all other features. 
> 
> I have no preference and defer to both of you.
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> -Liz

subject: Anne Makendra (HMS Grade 7 22-23) just sent you a message in Canvas.
body:
Subject: Library Books Due

HMS 7th graders,

As we close on another school year, please check your backpacks, cars, lockers, and homes and turn in any library books you find at your earliest convenience.  Holdrum Library books will have a barcode sticker that says "Holdrum Middle School" on the inside of the front cover.  If you discover any old Elementary School library books, I will happily send those over to the right school as well.

Thanks,

[PERSON_ddb342] can reply to this message in Canvas by replying directly to this email, or by clicking this link: https://rivervaleschools.instructure.com/conversations/942059.  If you need to include an attachment, please log in to Canvas and reply through the Inbox.







________________________________________

You received this email because you are participating in one or more classes using Canvas.  To change or turn off email notifications, visit:
https://rivervaleschools.instructure.com/profile/communication

 â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í â€‡Í Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­ Â­

subject: FERC Staff Investigations on Midwest and Southeast Bulk Power
body:
On 11/1/00, FERC Staff issued reports on its Investigation of Bulk Power 
Markets in the Eastern Interconnection.  These reports were the result of a 
Commission order earlier this summer.  Enron's Federal regulatory staff 
(Christi, Charles Yeung, and Sarah Novosel) provided a great deal of 
information for this investigation and Joe Hartsoe and Donna Fulton discussed 
many of the problems with the grid with the new head of Staff, Scott Miller 
(who recently joined FERC from PG&E Gen).    While the Commission is under no 
obligation to take any of Staff's recommendations, the Commission typically 
looks to Staff for guidance on transmission and market issues.  Importantly, 
Staff concludes that the Commission should consider these options for the 
Southeast and Midwest -- all of which Enron has been asking FERC to implement 
for several years:

Reduce the advantages of network service over point to point service by 
requiring that native load be served under the same tariff as other 
transmission services to eliminate the current incentives that VIUs have to 
favor their native load through the calculation of ATC and handling of 
interconnection requests.

While the Staff Hotline is used productively, the Commission can direct Staff 
to conduct formal investigations into entities that have a pattern of 
complaints.

The Commission could require TPs to submit tariff provisions containing a pro 
forma interconnection process specific to interconnection, rather than simply 
relying on the Tennessee Power order that utilizes the OATT timelines and 
procedures.

Require TPs to retain real-time transmission data on market functions 
pertaining to daily load, internal generation to meet that load, and imports 
and exports.

RTOs should submit the basis and methods for calculating ATC and TTC, as well 
as standardized criteria for curtailment.  In addition, since even such 
standardized criteria might not "get to the root of the problem" -- that 
control area still control generation -- the Commission could require that 
each RTO set a date certain by which it will create one control area.  
Regardless of the implementation of these two options, the Commission could 
standardize ATC and TTC methodology.

Staff finds that while electricity is a commodity with market characteristics 
similar to many other commodities, it is still viewed as "different," with a 
reaction of price caps.  Staff encourages that basic decisions about the 
regulatory model be made in order to complete the transition from a 
traditional cost-of-service model to a model that uses markets to price the 
commodity and services.  

DETAILS  (Also, the reports contain good summaries of the generation, 
transmission, state retail, federal reg. and other issues for the region):

Midwest:  The Midwest is dominated by vertically integrated Transmission 
Providers ("TPs") that control transmission, generation and load.  "As such, 
they have weak economic incentives to provide access to transmission service 
to third-parties and strong incentives to favor their own services."  Staff 
received numerous complaints; however, due to the lack of information 
available from TPs, Staff cannot conclude whether these are isolated 
incidents or wide-spread.  At the very least, the complaints indicate a lack 
of confidence in the bulk power market and the ability of market participants 
to rely on transmission access, thus harming the liquidity of the market.  

TLRs are the most important transmission issue in the Midwest, with an 
"enormous" increase in 2000.  The region showed a decline in peak load from 
1999 to 2000 and a growth in new generation since the 1998 price spikes.  
Even though there was an increase in generation and mild weather with 
virtually no price spikes, TLRs climbed to record numbers.  The TLRs were 
highly concentrated:  only 5 flowgates account for 41% of ECAR TLRs and 
another 5 flowgates in MAIN account for 42% in that region.  Notably, even 
though the NERC procedures for Level 3 TLRs mandate transaction curtailment, 
78 of the 191 TLRs in the Midwest do not show any curtailment amount.  The 
total amount of relief that these curtailments are intended to produce are 
not posted.  Staff notes that TLR rules are established by NERC, whose 
procedures are voluntary and not enforced by penalties.  While the Commission 
has required certain NERC standards and procedures to be placed in Open 
Access Transmission Tariffs ("OATT") where the Commission has the power to 
enforce provisions under the Federal Power Act, in practice the Commission 
has generally deferred to NERC on transmission reliability questions, 
including the propriety of TLRs.

TLRs inhibit optimal functioning of the transmission system and market 
because load is not served by the least cost supplier.  TLR procedure is an 
inefficient instrument in mitigating constraints -- curtailment by fiat.  In 
addition, the NERC IDC can result in inappropriate curtailments or increased 
loading on the affected flowgate.  The impact could be mitigated by one 
control area per RTO.

Staff notes that the Midwest state commissions did not petition FERC for 
price caps following the 1998 price spikes.  Some market participants believe 
that the absence of price spikes is the single reason that NUG construction 
increased in the Midwest.  

Market participants must keep track of, and follow, a plethora of information 
in order to make energy deals, submit reservations and provide schedules for 
service.  Staff received many complaints about barriers to transmission 
access, including TLR curtailments and a lack of standardized information and 
protocols, particularly for ATC and interconnection requests, and 
discriminatory conduct.  Unbelievably, key data was unavailable to Staff, 
such coincident peak load data, system-wide snap shots for days when TLRs 
were called, and import/export data.  This lack of data creates a market 
inefficiency, because neither market participants nor regulators can fully 
analyze market conditions in real time.  As such, the market is risk adverse, 
eschewing long-term deals for short-term transactions.  Staff also noted that 
because the Security Coordinators often work for the IOU, there is a mixed 
incentive to enforce reliability on the grid and maximize profit for the 
IOU.  (Staff cites Richard Tabors' paper, "Transmission Markets, Stretching 
the Rules for Fun and Profit.")

Staff cites the lack of information on OASIS or on the NERC web site, 
particularly about real time TLRs and curtailments.  Examples were provided 
to Staff of transmission refusals when there were no TLRs posted and improper 
implementation of TLRs causing substantial financial loss.

The currently proposed Midwest RTOs may mitigate some problems; however, all 
three retain existing control areas with the favortism for generation and 
native load.  These incentives will continue to remain until the RTO 
exercises complete autonomy over transmission control and security 
coordinator functions.  Staff notes that the Midwest is a balkanized region 
of 61 control areas with no uniform method for calculating ATC and CBM.  The 
result is that ATCs can be different on 2 different sides of an interface.  
Staff notes examples in inaccurate ATCs and states that Staff's own ATC audit 
this summer was consistent with market participant complaints.  Staff is 
weighing follow-up options.  The result of these problems is a lack of 
liquidity.

Staff next noted the problems with unfiled "business practices," especially 
on the next hour market.  Staff's audit of OASIS sites revealed several areas 
of non-compliance.  

Information transparency is necessary for a market to function efficiently, 
with equal and timely access to data, including ATC, CBM, TRM, and load flow 
input data.  TPs have incentives to resist efforts to make this information 
transparent because of native load.  This incentive will still exist under 
RTOs if utilities are allowed to calculate their own ATC.  ***  "As a 
consequence, the Commission may wish to eliminate the native load exemption 
and have all transactions under the same tariff."  ***  The Commission could 
benefit by having access to existing transmission data and should require the 
TPs to retain data, including current real-time network status.

Interconnection Issues:  IPPs need to be compensated for VAR support.  Also, 
Staff cites a number of Hotline complaints about TPs seeking large deposits 
or failing to complete System Impact Studies timely.  One solution is to have 
the RTO handle this function to eliminate the disincentive the utilities have 
against IPPs.  The current practice of requiring IPPs to deal with a wide 
variety of procedures inhibits the free flow of transactions within the 
region.

Network service has inherent advantages over point-to-point, citing the 
Entergy source and sink order.  The Commission has relied on "passively" 
receiving informal and formal complaints to determine if discriminatory 
behavior has occurred rather than actively canvassing market participants.  
While Staff cannot conclude that discriminatory practices are widespread, 
there is evidence of discriminatory instances.


Southeast:  The traditional vertically integrated utility ("VIU") model has 
largely persisted in the SE.  This continued control has vastly reduced the 
economic incentives to facilitate IPP activities.  In many cases, the VIUs 
have dampened IPP involvement without violating any Commission regulation due 
to the inherent flexibility of the current rules.

Staff cites examples of delays in performing system impact studies, 
transmission hoarding in the name of serving native load growth and 
manipulation of ATC.  TPs have shown little inclination to improve the 
transmission system and use many TLRs.

There is also a lack of market information that has stymied the development 
of markets in the SE.  ATCs change constantly that leads to uncer

subject: Outstanding Invoices
body:
Enron Transportation Services has 2115 outstanding invoices totaling nearly $8.5 million, which need coding and/or approval in the iPayit system.  Although a company-wide task force is working to improve the entire process, ETS employees need to do their part to ensure accurate and timely payment to our vendors.  
 
If you purchase items that generate an invoice (including cell phones, pagers, etc.) or if you are responsible for coding and/or approving invoices, after you receive your e-mail notification, please log on to iPayit and take the appropriate action to process the invoice (s) .  
 
Because the invoice (s)  cannot be processed for payment while it is in your iPayit inbox, it's important to code/approve invoices within five (5) days of e-mail notification.  
 
I expect ETS to stay current on payment of ALL vendor invoices.  
 
I have approved invoices in the system and it's very to use.  We will continue to monitor the status of our accounts payable, and we expect to see significant improvement by the end of September.
 
If you need assistance processing outstanding invoices, please contact Carolyn Centilli at [PHONE_REDACTED].   Password questions should be directed to the ISC help desk, [PHONE_REDACTED].
  
Thank you for your commitment to improving our accounts payable process and for paying our vendors on time.  
 
Rod

subject: This will help me sleep tonight
body:
[ https://act.leaderswedeserve.com/go/853?refcode=em20250705-1&t=1001&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2 ]Leaders We Deserve

   

   

   I take this job pretty seriously.

   I spend a lot of time thinking about how to help every single one of the
   candidates we endorse win their elections. And you want to know one thing
   that helps me sleep at night?

   Itâ€™s knowing that, since our launch in 2023, almost 14,[ADDRESS_REDACTED] signed up to make monthly recurring donations
   to Leaders We Deserve.

   [ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/em_lwd_20250705_1_recurringask?refcode=em20[PHONE_REDACTED]&amount=5&recurring=1&refcode2=2336_5330633_ZDJzI2&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2 ]These donations are crucial to sustaining a movement like ours, so
   today I wanted to reach out and ask if you would set up a monthly
   recurring donation too.

Use the links in this email to start a recurring donation to Leaders We Deserve.

   

                         [ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/em_lwd_20250705_1_recurringask?amount=5&refcode=em20[PHONE_REDACTED]&recurring=1&refcode2=2336_5330633_ZDJzI2&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2 ]Donate $5 Â»

   

   Hereâ€™s why these recurring donations are so helpful:

     *Â They allow us to set a baseline for what we bring in each month, so we
       can budget that money toward our most pressing priorities.

     *Â They help us get to work well before Election Day. A month before the
       election is too late to hire and train organizers, buy TV ads, and
       compete with more established, well-financed campaigns.

     *Â They help create a snowball effect for our candidates. A lot of donors
       and organizations look at how much early money candidates raise to
       inform whether they should get involved, and recurring donations let
       us back young, progressive candidates early on to show their
       credibility.

   [ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/em_lwd_20250705_1_recurringask?refcode=em20[PHONE_REDACTED]&amount=5&recurring=1&refcode2=2336_5330633_ZDJzI2&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2 ]So if youâ€™re ready to elect more of the Leaders We Deserve, please
   sign up to make a monthly recurring donation of any amount that works for
   you today. It will help more than you know!

   Thanks again for all your support,

   David Hogg

   P.S. Canâ€™t commit to a monthly donation today? Not a problem. [ https://secure.actblue.com/donate/em_lwd_20250705_1_recurringask?refcode=em20[PHONE_REDACTED]&amount=5&refcode2=2336_5330633_ZDJzI2&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2 ]If you
   can make a one-time contribution of $5 or any amount at
   all, youâ€™ll make a big difference in helping us reach our goals and elect
   the next generation of leaders.

   

     
     
   This email was sent to user_8a00487b@example.com. Email is a critical way we communicate with grassroots supporters like you. However, if you would like to change your subscription preferences, here are some options:

Receive Fewer Emails: https://act.leaderswedeserve.com/signup/receive-fewer-emails/?t=1002&akid=2336%2E5330633%2EZDJzI2
Update Your Information: https://act.leaderswedeserve.com/signup/update-your-information/

subject: Deadline today: Your support can make the difference!
body:
Dear Matthew,

Today is the last day to unlock an additional $100,000 for KQED, and we're so close! As of this morning, we need just 75 more supporters to reach our goal.
Â 
Your support keeps KQED stable in uncertain times so that we can be a trusted source of fact-based journalism, compelling storytelling and community engagement for everyone in our region. But this opportunity disappears at midnight. Can we count on you to help us secure extra funding?
Â  
With your help, we can make sure Maria Manetti Shrem's generous challenge is met and that KQED continues to thrive. Don't wait -- your chance to make twice the impact ends at midnight!
Â 
Thank you,

Michael J. Isip
President & CEO

- - - - - - - - - -

KQED: https://click.email.kqed.org/?qs=812e6227e35416cd9ba326c9111d46f0e89c730e0525cea28266220c17cab47191ef79345b0dd0546cdf76b648f59a4f82235cdbaff8bd6ab1de0e1d179c3ec2

- - - - - - - - - -

:: Give Now ::
https://donate.kqed.org/radiodrive?crm=roi&rfid=93604116&ms=P2502ECRNXXX04&gsp=true

- - - - - - - - - -

Last chance to unlock $100K

- - - - - - - - - -

Matthew, last week Maria Manetti Shrem challenged us to have 500 people contribute to KQED by 2/19. She generously offered to give us an additional $100,[ADDRESS_REDACTED] if we could meet this goal. Tomorrow is the day, and we still need more people to step forward and donate so that we can unlock these critical funds. Can you be the one to get us across the finish line?

At KQED, we believe that fact-based reporting, powerful storytelling and community engagement should be free and accessible to all. But right now the future of public media is not certain. Your support in unlocking this $100,000 gift has never been more crucial.

- - - - - - - - - -

Just 112 more supporters are needed to help us reach our goal by tomorrow. Make your gift now to help unlock $100,000 before the February 19 deadline.

:: Give Now ::
https://donate.kqed.org/radiodrive?crm=roi&rfid=93604116&ms=P2502ECRNXXX04&gsp=true

- - - - - - - - - -

If we meet our goal of 500 donors by tomorrow, Maria Manetti Shrem will donate an extra $100,000 in funds to KQED, ensuring we start our winter member drive from a place of strength. Don't wait, this critical opportunity is only active through February 19. Please make your gift today.

Thank you,

Michael J. Isip
President & CEO

P.S. Your gift today could be the one that secures an extra $100,000 for KQED. Please act now!

- - - - - -

:: Give Now ::
https://donate.kqed.org/radiodrive?crm=roi&rfid=93604116&ms=P2502ECRNXXX04&gsp=true

- - - - - - - - - -

We recently announced a new limited edition sculpture by Maurizio Cattelan. Entirely hand-painted, We are the Revolution sees the Italian artist scaled down for the latest evolution in his miniature works.

To celebrate the editionâ€™s release, weâ€™ve hidden three mini Maurizios across the globe â€“ in New York, London, and Amsterdam. Attached to each is a price tag (50Â¢, Â£0.99 and â‚¬5 respectively) â€“ the sculpture is yours for that cost if you can find it.

In New York, weâ€™re inviting you to hunt the sculpture down IRL. Itâ€™s waiting, for now, at the location in the image above. London and Amsterdam will open to digital guesses later this week.

The hunt launches today, 30 September. Click below to find out more information and to see when the clues and competition for each city will be available.

(https://cVbjR04.na1.hubspotlinks.com/Ctc/I6+113/cVbjR04/VVwZjQ7s537dW6Rrqrj4w1jw1W6YVQGc5D4fLdN5XFYm-3pyd0W7Y8-PT6lZ3pGW82Zm3d8jDlFmW1g5pWt2y2pZPW3ddYrW7s4LssVjpw4t15PDFWW6Cpb2z4v-0RRW8zrBMr7grx8HW758-MF1BgCwlV3T2g_472FtYW6T8tVW5DK2-WW47rcZb2HY4b-Vy31MR4m0tXFW5N_n5h1fJsKxN6CDWVMdPMVdW1V0R1f6MVSF3W4Pp-G14g_q8YW7xyp3198H8LpV2FNKB5xPYLdN8PS5dt-lPRMW4f3t-53KP2cNW28yQ8z19Xq1sW1j9qyM8M0fkhW1J8fxB93pD3BW73KFB767fR-0N19_n-bvqsJ0W6nDgkW1k4Yz6Vss47T35wkkmf39_M3q04 )

The sculpture, which arrives with a certificate of authenticity signed by Maurizio, is also available via draw entry now.

We are the Revolution

Maurizio Cattelan makes himself the punchline in this new limited edition sculpture.

Ralph Gibsonâ€™s photographic journey

Ralph Gibsonâ€™s

photographic journeyÂ 

Nudes, portraits, still lives, narratives: loyal to his Leica, Gibson ranges between genres and creates new categories of vision. Produced in close collaboration with the artist, this book offers the fruit of more than six decades of image-making. From Gibsonâ€™s first photographs in San Francisco, Hollywood, and New York in the 1960s right up to the present day, it isÂ the most comprehensive collection of this highly acclaimedÂ photographer.

body: Email from Maharishi Foundation USA + Higher States of Consciousness; TM Tip; "The Ageless Woman"; More | â€Š New Online Events From August 17, 2025 â€Š â€Š â€Š TM Â® Talks: â€œSports Psychology and the Value of Inner Silence for Athletesâ€ Sun., Aug. 17, 5 pm ET (60 min) More Stephen Franzeâ€”a sports psychologist, mental performance and ice hockey coach, and former physical trainerâ€”discusses his work with athletes, focusing on how they can recognize and overcome common mental and emotional challenges. He shares his goals for developing studentsâ€™ self-awareness by enhancing communication and strengthening their identity, both within and beyond their sport. [PERSON_3759ca] also reflects on his personal experience with the TM technique, explaining how it shaped his mindset and how it can help athletes reach their full potential. Connect via Zoom video: https://zoom.us/j/177174913 Connect by phone: Dial [PHONE_REDACTED] or [PHONE_REDACTED], then enter Meeting ID 177 174 913# Watch replays â€Š â€Š MIU Online: Higher States of Consciousness Sat., Aug. 30, 12 pm ET (75 min) Register In this inspiring online course from Maharishi International University (MIU), TM Founder Maharishi Mahesh Yogi describes how higher states of consciousness unfold in human life. His talks give special attention to Unity Consciousness, where one lives the wholeness of life in every part of individual existenceâ€”the totality of life in full enlightenment. Maharishi explains in great detail the transformation of mind and body that upholds this development, the nature of subjective experience in each of the higher states, and the practical values of life in enlightenment. The course includes 16 recorded talks by Maharishi, plus 9 live one-hour Zoom sessions on Saturdays at 12 pm ET with discussion and Q&A led by MIU Professor Gerry Geer. View a complete description of the course Sign up for Higher States of Consciousness â€Š â€Š TM Tip: Boost Your Life with a TM Retreat More A TM Retreat is our number one recommendation for new or seasoned meditators to recharge while deepening their TM practice. Participants remark on the profound rest they gainâ€”some say it fuels them for months! There are several types of TM Retreats to choose from, either online or in person, all with individual guidance from Certified TM Teachers, special videos by Maharishi, yoga practice, and more. Learn more about TM Retreats Learn more about a One-Day TM Retreat Find a TM Retreat near you â€Š â€Š â€Š The Ageless Woman: How to Navigate a Long Life of Vibrant Health and Radiant Beauty Order now The Ageless Woman, by [PERSON_633161], is a practical, informative, and empowering anti-aging handbook for women. It weaves the latest health discoveries with the timeless wisdom of Maharishi AyurVedaÂ®, the natural health system of India revitalized by Maharishi. Featuring self-quizzes and personalized recommendations, The Ageless Woman will help you manage peri-menopausal symptoms, attain a healthy weight, and balance your hormones, as well as keep your mind, heart, bones, and skin youthful and healthy for many years to come. Nancy Lonsdorf, MD, ABIHM, is board-certified in Integrative and Holistic Medicine, and was named â€œone of the nationâ€™s most prominent Ayurvedic doctorsâ€ by the Chicago Tribune. Order The Ageless Woman Read how to â€œBalance Your Hormones, Rejuvenate Your Brainâ€ Read about â€œ7 Self-Care Tips for Your Mind-Body Typeâ€ â€Š â€Š â€Š Join the Daily Morning and Afternoon Large Group Meditations No reservations needed. Just call in. More Meditate with thousands around the country! Bob Roth will host the call, lead a Group Meditation, and share insights on TM practice and tips for creating greater balance in life. ï»¿ Latest morning and evening schedules Find additional times and resources on TM-Meditate.org Connect via Zoom (audio): https://zoom.us/j/177174913 Connect by phone: Dial [PHONE_REDACTED] or [PHONE_REDACTED], then enter Meeting ID: 177 174 913# â€Š â€Š Maharishi Yoga SM AÂ­saÂ­nas and Pranayama: Online Group InstructÂ­ion and Practice Plus a 20â€‘minute Online Group Meditation Twice a week Register Fridays at 5 pm ET (60 min) Sundays at 11 am ET (60 min) More about Maharishi Yoga Asanas Led by Maharishi International University Faculty â€Š â€Š A variety of positions and work opportunities at: â€Š Maharishi International University ï»¿Fairfield, Iowa More info Maharishi School Fairfield, Iowa More info â€Š â€Š Â© 2025 Maharishi Foundation USA, Inc., a non-profit educational organization. Dear Customer,

We have just updated Amazon.com's privacy policy and, because
privacy is important, we wanted to e-mail you proactively in this
case and not just update the policy on our site, as is the common
Web practice.  Thanks for being a customer and allowing us to
continue to earn your trust.

To read the updated Privacy Notice, visit:

http://www.amazon.com/privacy-notice

Thanks again for shopping at Amazon.com.


Sincerely,

Amazon.com

you'd rather not receive any future notices of this sort from
Amazon.com, please send an e-mail message to
user_3dc6edc3@example.com. Please be aware that even if you choose
not to receive these updates, they will still cover your use of
Amazon.com.

Please note that this message was sent to the following e-mail
address:

 user_3edf04e9@example.com

 Sign Up [1] |Advertise [2]|View Online [3] 

		TLDR 

		TOGETHER WITH [Wiz] [4]

TLDR 2025-10-09

 THE MCP SECURITY GUIDE FOR EARLY ADOPTERS (SPONSOR) [4] 

 Is your team exploring MCP integrations?

The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is quickly emerging as the go-to
standard for connecting LLMs to external tools and data. But as
adoption picks up, many teams are implementing MCP without a clear
security playbook.

This practical guide [4] breaks down real-world MCP security risks and
offers actionable steps to help teams secure LLM integrations.

Inside the guide:

 	* Key risks with local and remote MCP servers
 	* Real-world threats like prompt injection and supply chain
compromise
 	* Actionable steps for safely using MCP tools

Download the guide [4] to get smart on securing MCP as adoption grows.

ðŸ“± 

BIG TECH & STARTUPS

 GOOGLE WANTS RIGHT TO BUNDLE GEMINI AI APP WITH MAPS, YOUTUBE (4
MINUTE READ) [5] 

 Google wants to retain the right to bundle Maps and YouTube with its
Gemini AI service. It claims that there is no evidence that it has
gained a monopoly or market power in the AI market. Maps and YouTube
have not been found to be monopoly products. Google says its bundle of
Gemini with YouTube and Maps is similar to Microsoft's inclusion of
its Copilot AI within its Office productivity software. 

 AMAZON LAUNCHES PRESCRIPTION VENDING MACHINES AT ONE MEDICAL CLINICS
IN LOS ANGELES (6 MINUTE READ) [6] 

 Amazon is launching prescription drug kiosks at some One Medical
offices in Los Angeles. They will work similarly to a vending machine
and distribute prescriptions for patients within minutes of their
doctor visit. Each machine can stock hundreds of prescriptions. By
bringing the pharmacy directly to the point of care, Amazon is
allowing patients to start treatments right away. Amazon plans to also
deploy its prescription vending kiosks at pharmacy chains like Rite
Aid, CVS, and Walgreens. 

ðŸš€ 

SCIENCE & FUTURISTIC TECHNOLOGY

 PLANET LABS TO LAUNCH SATELLITES PROMISING IMAGES IN AN HOUR (5
MINUTE READ) [7] 

 Planet Labs PBC's Earth observation satellites promise to deliver
high-resolution, AI-analyzed images within the hour. The new Owl
monitors will track changes ranging from the impacts of natural
disasters to the movements of vessels and aircraft. Owl satellites are
equipped with Nvidia chips, enabling them to use AI to identify
objects and detect events faster. Planet Labs plans to build and
deploy about 40 Owl satellites in the next few years, with an initial
test launch slated for the end of 2026. 

 HOW ULTRASOUND IS USHERING A NEW ERA OF SURGERY-FREE CANCER TREATMENT
(14 MINUTE READ) [8] 

 Histotripsy is a cancer treatment in which ultrasound waves are
concentrated onto a small area of a tumor to destroy it. The
ultrasound is delivered in quick bursts, creating tiny microbubbles
that expand and then collapse in milliseconds, breaking apart the
tumor tissue as they do. The patient's immune system then cleans up
the remains. The treatment is fast, non-toxic, and non-invasive.
Patients receiving it can usually go home on the same day, with most
procedures over in one to three hours. Histotripsy has been approved
by the US FDA for the treatment of liver tumors. 

ðŸ’» 

PROGRAMMING, DESIGN & DATA SCIENCE

 PLAID ADDS $382K IN PIPELINE WITH TLDR CAMPAIGN (SPONSOR) [9] 

 Plaid achieved their best-performing direct buy to date, adding $382k
in pipeline, earning 70 leads, and achieving 20.1x ROI. This case
study breaks down their strategy, results, and example ads.. Read the
Plaid case study. [9] 

 INTRODUCING THE REACT FOUNDATION: THE NEW HOME FOR REACT & REACT
NATIVE (3 MINUTE READ) [10] 

 React has grown into one of the world's most popular open source
projects since Meta open-sourced the project over a decade ago. The
incredible growth is thanks to its community. The React Foundation was
created to help the React community and its members. It will maintain
React's infrastructure, organize React Conf, and create initiatives to
support the React ecosystem. The React Foundation will be part of the
Linux Foundation. 

 A PRAGMATIC GUIDE TO MODERN CSS COLOURS (17 MINUTE READ) [11] 

 A lot about colors in CSS has changed over the last few years,
including updates to the syntax of familiar features and all-new ways
of working with colors. These new features can help developers who
don't necessarily focus on design. This article looks at the most
useful features for developers who aren't trying to pick their own
colors or do any color manipulation. 

ðŸŽ 

MISCELLANEOUS

 AN INTERVIEW WITH OPENAI CEO SAM ALTMAN ABOUT DEVDAY AND THE AI
BUILDOUT (38 MINUTE READ) [12] 

 In the last seven months, OpenAI has unveiled GPT-5, launched the
viral video app Sora, and made several announcements about a massive
AI buildout with a variety of partners. This article contains an
interview with OpenAI's Sam Altman, where he discusses all of those
infrastructure announcements, why Altman's investor skills are
particularly useful as CEO, apps in ChatGPT, Instant Checkout, Sora,
and how OpenAI thinks about user feedback. Altman and OpenAI are
presenting an increasingly coherent vision about what OpenAI is
building towards. The interview is also available as a podcast. 

 SHAYNE COPLAN BECOMES YOUNGEST SELF-MADE BILLIONAIRE AFTER
POLYMARKET'S $2B INVESTMENT: BBG (2 MINUTE READ) [13] 

 Shayne Coplan, founder and CEO of Polymarket, a blockchain-based
prediction market, has become the world's youngest self-made
billionaire at 27. His company will receive as much as $2 billion in
investment from Intercontinental Exchange. Polymarket lets users wager
on real-world outcomes using cryptocurrency. Users wagered more than
$3 billion on potential outcomes during the 2024 US presidential
election. 

âš¡ 

QUICK LINKS

 INVESTMENT OPP (90% FULL): TECHSTARS-BACKED RISE IS ELECTRIFYING THE
$600B HEAVY MACHINERY MARKET (SPONSOR) [14] 

 Founded by MIT alumni and backed by leading VCs, RISE Robotics is
replacing hydraulics with zero-emissions tech. $9.3M revenue, U.S.
military contracts, built the world's strongest robotic arm. $3.8M+
raised from 1780+ investors via Wefunder. Invest today [14] 

 OPENAI'S RISING TIDE STRATEGY (5 MINUTE READ) [15] 

 OpenAI's strategy may create a virtuous cycle where AI demand funds
AI build out, which fuels AI demand. 

 IN DEFENSE OF RUTHLESS MANAGERS (4 MINUTE READ) [16] 

 While most engineers would prefer an empathetic manager, there are
still several upsides to having a ruthless manager. 

 TOYOTA AIMS TO LAUNCH THE â€˜WORLD'S FIRST' ALL-SOLID-STATE EV
BATTERIES (3 MINUTE READ) [17] 

 Toyota claims its all-solid-state batteries, which could arrive as
soon as 2027, significantly enhance driving range, charging times, and
output. 

 LAUNCH PAYMENTS WITHOUT SACRIFICING SCALE OR INNOVATION (SPONSOR)
[18] 

 When it comes to issuing and processing payments, don't sacrifice
scale for flexibility (or vice versa). Get the best of both worlds
with Marqeta. SEE WHAT YOU CAN BUILD [18] 

 THE REMARKABLE RISE OF EBIRDâ€”THE WORLD'S BIGGEST CITIZEN SCIENCE
PROJECT (7 MINUTE READ) [19] 

 eBird allows ornithologists around the world to document bird
distribution, abundance, habitat use, and trends within a simple
scientific framework. 

 HOW WI-FI SIGNALS CAN BE USED TO DETECT YOUR HEARTBEAT (3 MINUTE
READ) [20] 

 Pulse-Fi, a new heart rate monitoring technique that uses ambient
Wi-Fi signals, is low-cost and easily deployable, and it removes the
need for people to wear devices on their bodies. 

 HUMAN-ORIENTED MARKUP LANGUAGE (2 MINUTE READ) [21] 

 Human-oriented Markup Language is a serialization language for
documents, datasets, and configuration that prioritizes strict form
for human readability.

 Share your referral link below with friends to get free TLDR swag!

Thanks for reading,

subject: EGM business presentation
body:
Rebecca,,

Attached, for your information, is  a copy of a general presentation that I 
prepared to illustrate and describe EGM's businesses.  This is a presentation 
that will become a "living" document to communicate our businesses and 
growth.  I will be making numerous changes as we move closer to the analyst 
meeting in January but I wanted to give everyone a copy of this version.

Please don't hesitate to call me if you have any questions or comments.

Mike

While you may be paying some of these bills, she lives in the house and is to be taking initiative to maintain the property that she has sole possession of. What I need to understand from you is if you are willing to endure this for four years.
